'I’ll cherish it forever' – Shubman Gill reflects after ICC player of the month award
Shubman Gill expressed immense joy upon receiving the ICC Men’s Player of the Month award for July, coinciding with his captaincy debut in the Test series. Gill highlighted his double century in Birmingham as a cherished moment, contributing to his impressive 754 runs in the Anderson Tendulkar Trophy.
'I’ll cherish it forever' – Shubman Gill reflects after ICC player of the month award | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'I’ll cherish it forever' – Shubman Gill reflects after ICC player of the month awardTrendingCommonwealth GamesVece PaesMichael AthertonCincinnati OpenSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesMichael AthertonCincinnati OpenSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesMichael AthertonCincinnati OpenSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed Salah'I’ll cherish it forever' – Shubman Gill reflects after ICC player of the month awardTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 14, 2025, 09:23 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShubman Gill expressed immense joy upon receiving the ICC Men’s Player of the Month award for July, coinciding with his captaincy debut in the Test series. Gill highlighted his double century in Birmingham as a cherished moment, contributing to his impressive 754 runs in the Anderson Tendulkar Trophy. India's player of the series India's captain Shubman Gill (AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth) Shubman Gill said being named ICC Men’s Player of the Month for July carried extra meaning as it came during his first Test series as India’s captain. Reflecting on the award, Gill said, “It feels great to be named the ICC Player of the Month for July. This time it holds a lot more significance since it has come for my performances during my first Test series as captain. The double ton in Birmingham is obviously something I’ll cherish forever and will be one of the highlights of my tour to England.”Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Gill’s numbers backed up his words. He was the standout performer in the Anderson Tendulkar Trophy, scoring 754 runs in 10 innings at an average of 75.40. July alone brought him 567 runs in three Tests at an average of 94.50, including three centuries and a career-best 269 at Edgbaston. That innings was not only a personal milestone but also the spark for India’s comeback after losing the series opener in Leeds.PollDo you believe Shubman Gill will continue to excel as India's captain in future series?Yes, definitelyProbablyUncertainNo, I don't think so His 430-run aggregate in Birmingham is one of the highest in Test history and the best by any visiting batter in England. Along the way, Gill surpassed Sunil Gavaskar’s record for most runs in a Test series as Indian captain and became the first Asian to score more than 700 runs in a series on English soil. While he had lean patches at Lord’s and The Oval, his earlier contributions ensured India finished the series 2-2. The award is Gill’s fourth, cementing his status as one of the game’s most consistent and impactful players.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

‘All part of...’- Joe Root shuts down David Warner’s taunt in style
Joe Root has downplayed David Warner's criticism of his batting technique, dismissing it as pre-Ashes banter. Root remains unfazed by Warner's comments about his struggles against Josh Hazlewood, emphasizing his focus on contributing to the team's success. He acknowledges the psychological gamesmanship common before such a significant series, aiming to ensure the talk doesn't affect England's performance.

Root remains unfazed by Warner's comments about his struggles against Josh Hazlewood, emphasizing his focus on contributing to the team's success. He acknowledges the psychological gamesmanship common before such a significant series, aiming to ensure the talk doesn't affect England's performance. England's Joe Root (AP Photo/Jon Super) England cricket star Joe Root has dismissed Australian batter David Warner's recent criticism about his batting technique as "all part of the fun" ahead of the upcoming Ashes series in Australia starting November 21. The comments come as England prepares for the crucial five-match tour following their 2-2 draw against India.The Ashes series holds significant importance for England's chances in the ICC World Test Championship final. England is also looking to secure their first Ashes victory in Australia since 2011 and their first overall since 2015.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Warner had targeted Root's performance against Australian pacer Josh Hazlewood, stating: "Josh Hazlewood tends to have his number quite a lot. He will have to take the surfboard off his front leg." The comment referenced Root's record against Hazlewood, who has dismissed him 10 times in 31 innings at an average of 31.40.Speaking to Sky Sports Root responded to Warner's comments with composure, saying: "Just that. I have no control over how people perceive the game or discuss it in an interview. Nothing new, is it? You know there are going to be storylines and people wanting to hype up a big series. Does not really change anything. It is sort of irrelevant to me. What can I do about it? Just make sure it is not a talking point in six months or 100 days' time."The English batter further added: "When you get out there, you have to got to try and impact the game and help your team get off to a good start. Business as usual as far as I am concerned. I guess it is all part of the fun. We will see what happens out there [with Warner at Lord's during The Hundred, where they are playing for Trent Rockets and London Spirit respectively]. It is not really in my nature to get too verbal."PollWill Joe Root score a century in the Ashes series?Yes, definitelyNo, not likelyMaybe, depends on conditionsRoot's performance in Australia has been notable despite not scoring a century there. He has accumulated 892 runs in 14 Tests and 27 innings, maintaining an average of over 35 with nine half-centuries and a highest score of 89.The pre-series verbal exchanges between players from both teams are considered a common strategy to create psychological pressure before the matches begin.Both Root and Warner will face each other at Lord's during The Hundred tournament, where they represent Trent Rockets and London Spirit respectively, before the Ashes series begins.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

AUS vs SA ODIs: Australia to be without three key players - Injuries force changes
Australia faces a setback before the ODI series against South Africa. Matt Short, Mitchell Owen, and Lance Morris are out due to injuries. Matthew Kuhnemann and Aaron Hardie have been named as replacements. The series will commence in Cairns. The remaining matches are scheduled in Mackay. Mitchell Marsh will lead the Australian team.
AUS vs SA ODIs: Australia to be without three key players - Injuries force changes | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAUS vs SA ODIs: Australia to be without three key players - Injuries force changesTrendingDewald BrevisVece PaesMichael AthertonCincinnati OpenSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahDewald BrevisVece PaesMichael AthertonCincinnati OpenSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahDewald BrevisVece PaesMichael AthertonCincinnati OpenSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahAUS vs SA ODIs: Australia to be without three key players - Injuries force changesTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 14, 2025, 10:02 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAustralia faces a setback before the ODI series against South Africa. Matt Short, Mitchell Owen, and Lance Morris are out due to injuries. Matthew Kuhnemann and Aaron Hardie have been named as replacements. The series will commence in Cairns. The remaining matches are scheduled in Mackay. Mitchell Marsh will lead the Australian team. Mitchell Owen is struck on the helmet off the bowling of Kagiso Rabada during game two in the T20 International series between Australia and South Africa (Photo by Robert Cianflone/Getty Images) Australia have been forced into reshuffling their squad ahead of the upcoming three-match ODI series against South Africa, with three players ruled out due to injury. Batter Matt Short (side strain), all-rounder Mitchell Owen (concussion) and pacer Lance Morris (back) will miss the series, which begins in Cairns on August 19.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Short is yet to recover from an injury sustained during training in the recent West Indies white-ball tour, while Morris has been sent back to Perth for further assessment after reporting back soreness. Owen suffered a blow to the helmet during the second T20I against South Africa and later developed delayed concussion symptoms. He will miss the final T20I and the entire ODI series under Cricket Australia’s 12-day concussion protocols. Spinner Matthew Kuhnemann and fast bowler Aaron Hardie have been named as replacements. Both were already in Queensland as part of the T20I squad, which is currently locked at 1-1 in the series.PollDo you think Australia can still perform well without the injured players?Yes, they have a strong squadNo, injuries will hurt their chances The ODI series will open in Cairns before moving to Mackay for matches on August 22 and 24.In the most recent meeting between the two sides, South Africa produced a dominant display in Darwin to level the T20I series 1-1, ending Australia’s nine-match winning streak in the format. The visitors outplayed the hosts in all departments, handing Australia their second-biggest T20I defeat at home in terms of runs. The 53-run victory was also South Africa’s biggest win by runs against Australia, as the home side were bowled out for 165. The series decider will be played on August 16.Australia ODI squad: Mitchell Marsh (c), Xavier Bartlett, Alex Carey, Ben Dwarshuis, Nathan Ellis, Cameron Green, Aaron Hardie, Josh Hazlewood, Travis Head, Josh Inglis, Matthew Kuhnemann, Marnus Labuschagne, Adam Zampa.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Rajasthan Royals ask for Jadeja or Ruturaj in swap deal for Sanju Samson
Sanju Samson's future with Rajasthan Royals is uncertain as the franchise explores trade possibilities, with owner Manoj Badale leading discussions with other IPL teams. RR reportedly approached Chennai Super Kings, expressing interest in Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in exchange for Samson, but CSK is unwilling to release these key players.
IPL Trade: Rajasthan Royals ask for Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in swap deal for Sanju Samson | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIIPLScheduleMI ScheduleCSK ScheduleRR ScheduleKKR ScheduleRCB ScheduleLSG ScheduleGT ScheduleDC SchedulePBKS ScheduleSRH Schedulepoints tableIPL Live ScoreIPL ResultsOrange CapPurple CapTeamsMI IPL SquadRCB IPL SquadLSG IPL SquadCSK IPL SquadGT IPL SquadKKR IPL SquadRR IPL SquadDC IPL SquadPBKS IPL SquadSRH IPL SquadPlayoffsstatsAll-Time RecordsHighest IPL ScoreMost IPL WicketsHighest Innings ScoreMost IPL 6Team with Most WinsPrediction HubphotosToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIPL NewsIPL Trade: Rajasthan Royals ask for Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in swap deal for Sanju SamsonTrendingCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahIPL Trade: Rajasthan Royals ask for Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in swap deal for Sanju SamsonTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 14, 2025, 13:20 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLarge AI-generated audio summary; not verified by the edit team.Sanju Samson's future with Rajasthan Royals is uncertain as the franchise explores trade possibilities, with owner Manoj Badale leading discussions with other IPL teams. RR reportedly approached Chennai Super Kings, expressing interest in Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in exchange for Samson, but CSK is unwilling to release these key players. Ruturaj Gaikwad, Sanju Samson and Ravindra Jadeja. The uncertainty over Sanju Samson’s future with Rajasthan Royals has grown, with fresh reports indicating that the franchise is actively working on potential trade options for their captain. As reported by Cricbuzz, RR have reached out to multiple IPL franchises to check if they are interested in acquiring the India wicketkeeper-batter. Lead owner Manoj Badale is said to be personally involved in the discussions. According to Cricbuzz, during these talks, Badale has even named specific players from other teams that the Royals would want in exchange for Samson. In the case of Chennai Super Kings, it is believed RR asked for either Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad as part of a swap. These demands are understood to be deal-breakers for CSK, who are not willing to release two of their most important players.What went wrong with CSK in IPL 2025Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Shivam Dube’s name has also been mentioned in some conversations, but Chennai are reportedly unwilling to part with the India all-rounder either. In fact, CSK officials are said to be reluctant to release any of their current players. This makes a direct swap between Samson and CSK seem unlikely at present, unless lengthy negotiations change the equation or Samson’s name comes up in the auction. However, there is no certainty that Samson will even enter the auction. RR are believed to be in serious trade talks with more than one team, and there is interest from several other franchises. This means another franchise could step in and finalise a deal before the auction stage. Samson, who has been with RR for several seasons and captained them in recent years, has reportedly made a formal request to the management for a move, stating that he wants to take his career in a new direction. Over the past seasons, there have been reports of differences between Samson and the team’s decision-makers.PollWhich player would you prefer to see swapped for Sanju Samson?Ravindra JadejaRuturaj GaikwadShivam DubeNone of the aboveOne point of tension was the Royals’ choice to release Jos Buttler before the last season while retaining Shimron Hetmyer. Samson had previously told Star Sports that letting Buttler go was one of the most difficult calls for him, and during a dinner with Buttler in the England series, he admitted he was still not over it. Despite these issues, Samson has avoided making any negative public comments about the franchise. In a recent podcast with R Ashwin, he said the Rajasthan Royals setup means a lot to him and spoke highly of Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the young left-handed batter who replaced him at the top of the order in the RR batting line-up. If a suitable trade does not materialise, Samson could still remain with Rajasthan Royals, as releasing or trading a player is entirely the franchise’s decision. The player’s role in this process is limited to making a formal request. For now, the situation remains open-ended, and it is clear that Samson’s next move will be one of the biggest talking points of the upcoming IPL off-season.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics.

Watch: Akash Deep gets royal welcome after historic triumph in England
Akash Deep, fresh off India's drawn series in England, received a hero's welcome upon returning home, as shown in a video posted by Lucknow Super Giants. His impactful performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, including a 10-wicket haul in Birmingham and a crucial half-century at The Oval, fueled India's success. The celebrations highlighted his significant contribution and the community's pride.
Watch: Akash Deep gets royal welcome after historic triumph in England | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsWatch: Akash Deep gets royal welcome after historic triumph in EnglandTrendingDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepAhmed ShehzadWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepAhmed ShehzadWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepAhmed ShehzadWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementKashsih KapoorWatch: Akash Deep gets royal welcome after historic triumph in EnglandTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 14, 2025, 07:19 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAkash Deep, fresh off India's drawn series in England, received a hero's welcome upon returning home, as shown in a video posted by Lucknow Super Giants. His impactful performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, including a 10-wicket haul in Birmingham and a crucial half-century at The Oval, fueled India's success. The celebrations highlighted his significant contribution and the community's pride. AKASH DEEP (X- Lucknow Super Giants)  Lucknow Super Giants posted a heartwarming video on X showing Akash Deep’s return home after India’s thrilling 2-2 series draw in England. Riding in an open jeep, the fast bowler was greeted like a local hero, with garlands placed around his neck and flowers showered on him by cheering crowds lining the streets. The celebration reflected the pride of a community welcoming back one of its own after a career-defining performance. Akash’s journey in the 2025 Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy was nothing short of remarkable. Missing the series opener, he made an instant impact in Birmingham by taking a 10-wicket haul in his first match of the tour, turning the momentum in India’s favour.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! He finished the series with 13 wickets, consistently providing early breakthroughs and troubling England’s top order. His pace and precision, particularly when paired with Mohammed Siraj, became a crucial weapon for India. But it was not just his bowling that made headlines. At The Oval in the decisive fifth Test, Akash stepped up with the bat when promoted as a nightwatchman. His maiden Test half-century, a composed 66 off 94 balls, featured a vital 131-run stand with Yashasvi Jaiswal. That knock gave India the cushion they needed to clinch a six-run victory in one of the most dramatic finishes in recent history.PollDo you think Akash Deep is now a key player for India's bowling attack?YesNoUndecided Akash credited coach Gautam Gambhir for helping him realise his potential and perform under pressure. His homecoming scenes showed just how much his achievement meant to fans – a celebration of grit, self-belief and a player who has truly arrived on the big stage.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'The quality wasn't as good': Michael Atherton compares 2005 Ashes to India-England series
Michael Atherton, the former England captain, acknowledges the recent India-England series as the most captivating since the iconic 2005 Ashes. While not surpassing the Ashes' quality, Atherton highlighted the series' dramatic twists, reminiscent of Chris Woakes' and Rishabh Pant's selfless acts, as they came out to bat despite nursing injuries.
'The quality wasn't as good': Michael Atherton compares 2005 Ashes to India-England series | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNews'The quality wasn't as good': Michael Atherton compares 2005 Ashes to India-England series'The quality wasn't as good': Michael Atherton compares 2005 Ashes to India-England seriesTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 14, 2025, 08:39 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMichael Atherton, the former England captain, acknowledges the recent India-England series as the most captivating since the iconic 2005 Ashes. While not surpassing the Ashes' quality, Atherton highlighted the series' dramatic twists, reminiscent of Chris Woakes' and Rishabh Pant's selfless acts, as they came out to bat despite nursing injuries. Shubman Gill and Ricky Ponting in 2025 and 2005 respectively (Images via Getty Images) Former England captain Michael Atherton has rated the recently concluded India-England five-Test series and drawn comparisons to the iconic 2005 Ashes series.In conversation with ex-England skipper and commentator Nasser Hussain, Atherton dismissed comparisons that placed the contest above the iconic Ashes battle but admitted it came closest in terms of drama and twists.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! “No, I don’t think the quality was as good as ’05. I mean, I don’t think I’ll see a better series than the ’05 Ashes. One team on the rise, one great team on the decline, an emerging team with absolutely great players at the top of their game,” Atherton said on Sky Sports Cricket. He explained that while 2005 set an unmatched benchmark, this latest series stood out for its unpredictable nature. “I’d probably put this one as the best since ’05 because of those dramatic moments — like Chris Woakes, and Rishabh Pant, and the way the series twisted and turned. So I reckon it’s probably the best series I’ve covered since ’05,” he added.IND vs ENG: Mohammed Siraj reflects on memorable win at The Oval The five-match contest ended 2-2 after India sealed a tense victory in the final Test at The Oval. The last day saw wickets fall quickly and emotions run high in a fiercely fought battle between the two sides. In contrast, the 2005 Ashes, which is widely considered one of the greatest Test series in history, saw England edge Australia 2-1 to reclaim the urn for the first time since 1986-87. That series remains remembered for its high-quality cricket, nail-biting finishes and lasting impact on the sport.PollWhich series do you think had more dramatic moments?2025 India-England Series2005 Ashes SeriesWhile Atherton’s verdict doesn't place the series on par or better than the 2005 Ashes, he still placed the India-England clash in elite company. The 2025 Ashes will commence on November 21.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'I hate this sooo much': Rishabh Pant shares injury struggle on social media
Rishabh Pant, sidelined with a toe fracture sustained during the England series, expressed his frustration on social media. However, the injured cricketer is finding ways to keep his spirits up. Pant shared a video of himself playfully baking pizzas, showcasing his culinary skills while recovering. Despite his uncertain return date, Pant's lighthearted approach to recovery is evident.
Cricket | 'I hate this sooo much': Frustrated Rishabh Pant shares injury struggle on social media | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsCricket | 'I hate this sooo much': Frustrated Rishabh Pant shares injury struggle on social mediaTrendingDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorCricket | 'I hate this sooo much': Frustrated Rishabh Pant shares injury struggle on social mediaTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 22:33 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRishabh Pant, sidelined with a toe fracture sustained during the England series, expressed his frustration on social media. However, the injured cricketer is finding ways to keep his spirits up. Pant shared a video of himself playfully baking pizzas, showcasing his culinary skills while recovering. Despite his uncertain return date, Pant's lighthearted approach to recovery is evident. File Pic: Rishabh Pant reacts in pain after taking a blow to the foot. (Getty Images) NEW DELHI: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has been ruled out of action since the fourth Test of India's recently concluded Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series against England, and his absence looks set to continue for some time following a painful toe fracture sustained during the match. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The southpaw picked up the injury when an attempt to reverse sweep off Chris Woakes struck his right toe, forcing him to play through discomfort before being sidelined.PollDo you think Rishabh Pant will make a successful comeback after his injury?Absolutely!Maybe, depends on recovery.Uncertain, injuries are tough.On Wednesday, Pant took to Instagram to vent his frustration, posting a picture of his plastered foot on his story with the blunt caption: “I hate this sooo much.” But while the frustration is real, Pant has found a lighter way to pass the time — in the kitchen. Earlier in the day, the 27-year-old shared a playful social media video of himself baking pizzas, limping slightly yet grinning in a chef's apron as he kneaded dough and arranged toppings.“Ghar pe to kuch banaya nahi hai, yaha pizza bana raha hai” (“I haven't cooked anything at home, and here I am making pizza”), Pant quipped, adding an Italian flourish to his caption: “Impasto, salsa, forno… and me.”In the clip, Pant told viewers, “Today I'm going to show you how to make pizza… I think I'm gonna make vegetarian pizza. With the truffle? Yeah, with the truffle.”Ever the entertainer, he joked mid-session: “Can I use your scissor, please? Where is it? Pizza is getting ready. I'm going to wait for it. Very hot in here, boys and girls.” He signed off with his trademark chuckle: “That's the only thing I can do with a broken foot right now. Mother must be thinking — ghar pe to kuch banaya nahi hai, yaha pizza bana raha hai.”Watch:While his comeback date remains uncertain, Pant's latest posts prove that even in recovery, he's keeping his spirits high.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. 

We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousGorgeous pictures of Sonia Virat Kohli drops major hint at ODI comeback ahead of Australia series
Virat Kohli is preparing for the upcoming Australia ODI series in October, following the postponement of the Bangladesh ODIs. He was recently seen training with Naeem Amin, hinting at his readiness for international cricket. While the BCCI is mindful of Kohli and Rohit Sharma's age, their experience and record in ODIs remain invaluable for India.
Virat Kohli drops major hint at ODI comeback ahead of Australia series | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsVirat Kohli drops major hint at ODI comeback ahead of Australia seriesTrendingDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorVirat Kohli drops major hint at ODI comeback ahead of Australia seriesTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 22:48 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeVirat Kohli is preparing for the upcoming Australia ODI series in October, following the postponement of the Bangladesh ODIs. He was recently seen training with Naeem Amin, hinting at his readiness for international cricket. While the BCCI is mindful of Kohli and Rohit Sharma's age, their experience and record in ODIs remain invaluable for India. Virat Kohli (AFP Photo) NEW DELHI: Former India captain Virat Kohli, who has retired from T20Is and Tests and now focuses solely on ODIs, is gearing up for the Australia series in October after the postponement of the Bangladesh ODI series in August. Kohli recently posted a photo from an indoor net session, signalling his readiness for a return to international cricket since his last outing at the Champions Trophy.Virat Kohli on why did he retire from Test cricket: 'It's time when you...'Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!In the image shared on his Instagram story, Kohli was seen training with Gujarat Titans’ assistant coach Naeem Amin. “Thanks for helping out with the hit, brother. Always lovely to see you,” he wrote. A fan page later reposted the picture, hinting at Kohli’s preparation for the Australian ODIs — a post that received a like from Kohli’s official account.Both Kohli and Rohit Sharma continue to feature in ODIs after stepping away from T20Is and Tests. Rohit remains the ODI captain, while Kohli is still a central figure in the format. The BCCI, however, is treading carefully regarding their long-term ODI futures, with age emerging as a key discussion point. By the 2027 ODI World Cup, Rohit will be 40 and Kohli 39.Despite this, their combined ODI record — 83 centuries and over 25,000 runs — underscores their value to the team. While India have transitioned from relying on them in other formats, their impact in 50-over cricket remains significant. The Australia series, set for October 19–25, will be India’s next ODI assignment, with both veterans expected to play vital roles.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Asia Cup | Shubman Gill - BCCI's new poster boy should lead India in T20Is too
With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma all but retired, the BCCI’s search for a new on-field leader and marketable face has turned to Shubman Gill. Already India’s Test captain, his growing brand value, T20I record, and leadership credentials make him a strong contender for the white-ball captaincy as well.
Shubman Gill: BCCI's new poster boy should lead India in T20Is too | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsShubman Gill: BCCI's new poster boy should lead India in T20Is tooTrendingDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorShubman Gill: BCCI's new poster boy should lead India in T20Is tooPratyush Raj / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 19:50 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWith Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma all but retired, the BCCI’s search for a new on-field leader and marketable face has turned to Shubman Gill. Already India’s Test captain, his growing brand value, T20I record, and leadership credentials make him a strong contender for the white-ball captaincy as well. London: India's captain Shubman Gill acknowledges the crowd after India won the fifth Test match against England, at The Oval cricket ground, in London, England. (PTI Photo/R Senthilkumar)(PTI08_04_2025_000309B) New Delhi: In the past few weeks, social media videos have been doing the rounds where Shubman Gill's dismissals in Test cricket and then his centuries in the recently concluded Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy have been heavily compared. The lyrics from the song "Kachha Ghada" by singer Rahgir have been used, and the line says: “Ye jo has rahi hai duniya, meri nakamiyon pe... kal ye marenge taali meri kahaniyon pe” (Those who are mocking me for my failures today will clap for my story tomorrow).Eyebrows were raised when he was appointed as India's Test captain, with legends of the game questioning his spot in the playing XI. He answered his critics with 754 runs, almost overhauling Sunil Gavaskar's all-time record, and was presented with a customised shirt and cap by the 'Little Master.'IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill on Oval thriller, Siraj's spell, and missing Rishabh Pant and Jasprit BumrahGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Shubman Gill, a Gen Z, used Karan Aujla's famous track Ghabru on his Insagram with the caption, “The storm only rattles those who aren't ready for it.” He answered all his critics in a very nonchalant way -- both with his bat and his captaincy.India's captain Shubman Gill celebrates after scoring a century on the final day of the fourth cricket test match between England and India at Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester, England, July 27, 2025.(AP Photo/Jon Super)England wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler, who played under Gill's captaincy at the Gujarat Titans, has called his style of leadership a combination of the “intensity” of Virat Kohli and the “more laid-back” approach of Rohit Sharma. Buttler was right -- Gill hassled England with intent and elegance.The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) took a gamble, and Shubman swiftly filled the void left by Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma -- two of its biggest modern-day giants.Gill is not only filling the void with runs and leadership but also in brand value, and has already become the darling of the broadcasters. The leap can be gauged by MRF's investment on legendary batters going from Sachin Tendulkar to Virat Kohli and now Gill in a deal estimated to be worth Rs 8-10 crore per year.Remember the Virat Kohli Cam and Rohit Sharma Cam that broadcasters added to keep fans glued? Shubman is their answer.The other poster boy of Indian cricket is Jasprit Bumrah, hands down the magician who wears many hats. But with his persistent back injury and workload management, he won't be playing all of India’s matches.The brand equationFrom a commercial standpoint, Kohli and Rohit weren’t just cricketers; they were multi-million-dollar brands. Their mere presence boosted television ratings, ticket sales, and sponsorship value. Broadcasters built campaigns around them. Sponsors tailored entire ad shoots to their availability. Losing both at once was always going to create a vacuum, and the BCCI’s marketing minds are well aware that a successor must be groomed not just on the field, but in the marketplace.With Shubman Gill, they have a young poster boy for the next generation. With his elegant strokeplay, calm demeanour, and youthful appeal, he has already become a favourite with advertisers.Suryakumar Yadav has an impressive track record as India’s full-time T20I captain after Rohit Sharma retired from the format following the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph. Under his leadership, India have won 17 out of 22 matches.New Delhi, Aug 8 (IANS) Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel believes Test skipper Shubman Gill answered all challenges and questions through his prolific run-scoring spree during the recently drawn Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series against England.There is no question about Surya the T20I batter -- he can entertain the crowd. But can he fill stadiums?This is the question coach Gautam Gambhir, chief selector Ajit Agarkar, and top BCCI officials will have to answer during the Asia Cup squad selection, given that the T20 World Cup will be played at home. Will they extend the line of thought by giving Shubman the white-ball captaincy as well? It would also make life easier for coach Gambhir. No coach anywhere in the world would want to deal with different captains for different formats.Numbers don’t lieBy no means is Shubman Gill a dud in the T20I format.In 21 T20Is, his strike rate is close to 140, and with added responsibility, he can only flourish - as seen in England. His Test average was in the mid-30s before the start of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, and he ended up chasing Don Bradman's batting record. Gill has shown that he is someone who will not buckle under added responsibility; instead, he thrives on it.In the IPL, he captains Gujarat Titans. In the first season, he showed some vulnerability but bounced back in his second season as captain, guiding them to the playoffs.New Delhi, Aug 7 (IANS) After captaining India to a 2-2 Test series draw in England, Shubman Gill has been appointed as the captain of the North Zone squad for the upcoming Duleep Trophy, starting on August 28 in Bengaluru.Since moving to Titans from Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), Gill has risen immediately to the leadership group under then-captain Hardik Pandya. He was pivotal in Titans winning the IPL title in 2022 with 483 runs at the top. Next season, he responded with an 890-run season with a strike rate of 157.80. In the last three IPL seasons, his strike rates have been 158.80, 147.40, and 155.88.His childhood mentor Gurkeerat Singh Mann has explained how Gill worked on his power-hitting.“He has always been a traditional batter, who was told by his father that hitting in the air is a sin in cricket. But once he was tipped as not good enough for T20I cricket, he added that power game to his repertoire -- and now see the sixes he hits, all of them above 90m,” Mann told TimesofIndia.com.“Before he joined Gujarat Titans, he started training in an open net at the IS Bindra Stadium in Mohali. He wanted to make sure that he was hitting it long and big. He was not happy with the sixes falling just behind the ropes. He used to get miffed. But that tells you his hunger to improve,” he added.PollDo you believe Shubman Gill can fill the leadership void left by Kohli and Sharma?AbsolutelySomewhatNot reallyNot at allIf the BCCI takes the bait by making Gill captain for the Asia Cup, it will provide them with the opportunity to build a young, fearless side under a fresh leader -- a rare combination.With two giants gone and Bumrah’s appearances in internationals carefully rationed, Gill could be the steady, stylish, and strategic leader India needs -- one who can carry the team on the field and the brand off it. The stage is his; the time might just be now.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Pic | 'Buggi night': Zaheer's post with Rohit, Yuvraj coincides with LSG shake-up
Zaheer Khan's Instagram post featuring Rohit Sharma and Yuvraj Singh sparked nostalgia among fans, highlighting their enduring camaraderie. Rohit recently achieved the No. 2 spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings, while Zaheer is reportedly parting ways with the Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2026, as the franchise plans organisational changes.
'Buggi night': Zaheer Khan's post with Rohit Sharma, Yuvraj Singh coincides with LSG shake-up - see pic | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'Buggi night': Zaheer Khan's post with Rohit Sharma, Yuvraj Singh coincides with LSG shake-up - see picTrendingDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih Kapoor'Buggi night': Zaheer Khan's post with Rohit Sharma, Yuvraj Singh coincides with LSG shake-up - see picTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 14, 2025, 01:12 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeZaheer Khan's Instagram post featuring Rohit Sharma and Yuvraj Singh sparked nostalgia among fans, highlighting their enduring camaraderie. Rohit recently achieved the No. 2 spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings, while Zaheer is reportedly parting ways with the Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2026, as the franchise plans organisational changes. Zaheer Khan (PTI Photo) NEW DELHI: India’s cricketing stars were back together — at least for one evening — as former pacer Zaheer Khan shared a smiling picture with ODI skipper Rohit Sharma and former all-rounder Yuvraj Singh.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Zaheer posted the photograph on Instagram with the caption, “Buggi night with Shana log,” giving fans a throwback to the camaraderie during their playing days. The reunion came at an eventful time for both Zaheer and Rohit, albeit for different reasons.PollAre you excited to see Rohit Sharma return for the ODI series against Australia?Yes, can't wait!No, not really.For Rohit, the get-together capped a week that saw him climb to No. 2 in the ICC ODI batting rankings, overtaking Pakistan’s Babar Azam. With 756 points, the 38-year-old sits just behind Test captain Shubman Gill (784). The rise comes despite Rohit not having played an ODI since India’s Champions Trophy triumph earlier this year, with his last competitive outing being in the 2025 IPL season. Former captain Virat Kohli holds fourth spot (736), while Shreyas Iyer (8th) and KL Rahul (15th) give India a strong top-15 presence.Rohit, who has retired from Tests and T20Is, is currently on a break and is expected to return for the three-match ODI series against Australia in October.Zaheer Khan: 'Rishabh Pant's calibre and ability never in doubt'For Zaheer, the week brought a different kind of headline. As TimesofIndia.com reported earlier, the Lucknow Super Giants are set to part ways with their mentor ahead of IPL 2026. According to sources, LSG will appoint a new mentor with a bigger, cross-franchise role, while owner Sanjiv Goenka is expected to name a Director of Cricket to oversee RPSG Group’s other teams, including Durban’s Super Giants (SA20) and Manchester Originals (The Hundred).Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

'If they are saying so much to Sachin …': When Dravid took a cheeky dig at crowd criticism
RP Singh recently shared a humorous anecdote from 1999, revealing Rahul Dravid's witty side. During a Ranji Trophy match where Dravid scored 199, they watched Sachin Tendulkar bat in an India match. Tendulkar's run-a-ball innings prompted some criticism, leading Dravid to quip about the potential reactions to his own, more measured, batting approach.
'If they are saying so much to Sachin Tendulkar …': When Rahul Dravid took a cheeky dig at crowd criticism | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'If they are saying so much to Sachin Tendulkar …': When Rahul Dravid took a cheeky dig at crowd criticismTrendingDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih KapoorDewald BrevisChinnaswamy StadiumWI vs PAKCorbin BoschRashid KhanTymal MillsAhmed ShehzadSuresh RainaHarbhajan SinghKashsih Kapoor'If they are saying so much to Sachin Tendulkar …': When Rahul Dravid took a cheeky dig at crowd criticismTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 20:51 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRP Singh recently shared a humorous anecdote from 1999, revealing Rahul Dravid's witty side. During a Ranji Trophy match where Dravid scored 199, they watched Sachin Tendulkar bat in an India match. Tendulkar's run-a-ball innings prompted some criticism, leading Dravid to quip about the potential reactions to his own, more measured, batting approach. Rahul Dravid (Pic credit: Rajasthan Royals) NEW DELHI: Former India pacer RP Singh has shared a witty 1999 exchange with cricket legend Rahul Dravid about Master Blaster Sachin Tendulkar, offering a glimpse into Dravid’s understated sense of humour.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Speaking on the latest episode of JioHotstar special Cheeky Singles, Singh recalled a Ranji Trophy clash in Meerut between Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh, where Dravid scored a commanding 199. That evening, the two attended dinner at a friend’s house while an India match was being broadcast on TV.Sachin Tendulkar at 52: Power, Pride, and a Nation’s PulsePollWhich aspect of Rahul Dravid's career do you admire the most?His techniqueHis temperamentHis consistency“There was a Ranji Trophy match going on in Meerut, Karnataka vs Uttar Pradesh. Rahul Dravid bhai had come to play and scored 199 runs. That night, we went to dinner at someone's house. India’s match was going on that day, and Sachin paaji was batting. He was playing a run-a-ball innings. We were both sitting on the side, and people were saying, ‘Sachin should play a little faster.’ But he was playing according to the situation of the match. Rahul bhai whispered in my ear, ‘If they are saying so much to him, then how much would they have said to me?’” Singh recounted.Nicknamed “The Wall” for his rock-solid technique, Dravid was renowned for his patient batting style, often testing the resolve of bowlers and fans alike. By the time he retired, he had piled up 13,288 runs in 164 Tests with 36 centuries, and 10,889 runs in 344 ODIs, including 12 hundreds — numbers that firmly establish him among cricket’s all-time greats.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. Rohit Sharma, India's ODI captain, is trending due to a viral video showcasing his dance moves with wife Ritika Sajdeh at her brother's wedding in 2023. Despite being on a break after the 2025 IPL season, Rohit has climbed to No. 2 in the ICC ODI rankings, surpassing Babar Azam.

(Video grab) NEW DELHI: India's ODI captain Rohit Sharma is making headlines off the pitch, with a viral video showing the star batter dancing with wife Ritika Sajdeh at her brother's wedding. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The video is reportedly from 2023, and the girl accompanying the star couple in the dance moves was the bride of the big day. The clip, which has lit up social media, also features the couple practising their moves at home before the big performance. 'Never Dreamt of This...': Rohit Sharma's BIG CONFESSION After Retirement From Test CricketWATCH:The 38-year-old is currently on a break from cricket following the 2025 IPL season. In the latest ICC ODI rankings for batters released on Wednesday, Rohit climbed to No. 2, overtaking Pakistan's Babar Azam, who slipped to third after a lean series against the West Indies. With 756 points, Rohit now sits just behind India's Test captain Shubman Gill (784).PollWhat do you think of Rohit Sharma's dance moves at the wedding?Impressive and fun!A nice break from cricket!Former captain Virat Kohli holds fourth spot with 736 points, while Shreyas Iyer (8th) and KL Rahul (15th) ensure India has five batters in the top 15.Rohit and Kohli, both retired from Test cricket earlier this year, are expected to feature in the three-match ODI series against Australia in October. The veteran opener recently began training with former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar in Mumbai, signalling he's not ready to walk away from the 50-over game just yet.An ODI legend with 32 centuries — behind only Virat Kohli (51) and Sachin Tendulkar (49) — Rohit was Player of the Match in India's Champions Trophy final win against New Zealand earlier this year.Amid his ranking surge, it's his wedding dance steps — not his trademark pull shots — that are stealing the spotlight.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. ‘Rawalpindi pitch lekar...’: Akhtar’s stinging remark on Pakistan batters
Shoaib Akhtar has strongly criticized Pakistan's cricket team, led by Mohammed Rizwan, for their dismal performance in the ODI series against the West Indies, who secured their first series win since 1991. Akhtar accused the batters of prioritizing personal averages over the team's victory, highlighting a lack of intent and adaptability to modern cricket.
‘Rawalpindi pitch lekar nahi ghoom sakte’: Shoaib Akhtar’s stinging remark on Pakistan batters - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNews‘Rawalpindi pitch lekar nahi ghoom sakte’: Shoaib Akhtar’s stinging remark on Pakistan batters‘Rawalpindi pitch lekar nahi ghoom sakte’: Shoaib Akhtar’s stinging remark on Pakistan battersTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 13, 2025, 20:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShoaib Akhtar has strongly criticized Pakistan's cricket team, led by Mohammed Rizwan, for their dismal performance in the ODI series against the West Indies, who secured their first series win since 1991. Akhtar accused the batters of prioritizing personal averages over the team's victory, highlighting a lack of intent and adaptability to modern cricket. Shoaib Akhtar (Photo: Video grab) Former Pakistan speedster Shoaib Akhtar has slammed the Mohammed Rizwan-led side for their poor performance in the ODI series against the West Indies.The West Indies clinched their first ODI series victory over Pakistan since 1991 with a commanding 202-run win in the decisive third match at Tarouba on Tuesday. Fast bowler Jayden Seales produced stunning figures of 6-18, while captain Shai Hope struck an unbeaten century as the hosts bowled out Pakistan for just 92 while defending 294-6.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Akhtar lambasted Pakistan’s batters, accusing them of not playing for the team.“We used to have expressive and explosive talent, and we played like that. We were never dependent on one individual — everyone chipped in,” Akhtar said on the Game On Hai show.“No one used to look for escape routes. The environment has changed, and in the last 10–15 years, everyone has started playing for themselves. Everyone is playing for their averages. The intent should be to win matches for your country.PollWhat do you think is the main issue with Pakistan's batting performance in the recent ODI series against the West Indies?Lack of teamworkPoor individual performancesInability to handle pressureAll of the above“We need to change the intent, the mindset, and create that atmosphere. You need to play according to modern cricket. How hard is that to understand?” he added.Pakistan’s chase fell apart early, collapsing to 23-4 in the ninth over, with three ducks among the top four batters. Opener Saim Ayub was caught behind on the third ball of the innings, Abdullah Shafique also failed to score, and captain Mohammad Rizwan was bowled by Seales for a golden duck in the third over.Seales claimed his fourth wicket when he trapped Babar Azam (9) lbw.“Halka sa seam hota hai toh musibat pad jaati hai (The ball moves a bit and they are in trouble),” Akhtar said. “Rawalpindi pitch lekar nahi ghoom sakte (You can’t carry Pindi pitches everywhere).”About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics.

'My plus one...': Arjun's fiancée’s adorable pictures with Sara Tendulkar – IN PICS
Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandhok, granddaughter of Mumbai entrepreneur Ravi Ghai. The intimate ceremony was attended by close family and friends. Sister Sara Tendulkar shared heartwarming photos with her future sister-in-law, expressing her joy. Saaniya is an entrepreneur and animal welfare advocate, founding Mr. PAWS, a pet care brand.
'My plus one forever': Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée’s adorable pictures with Sara Tendulkar – IN PICS | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperNewsSports NewsMore sports News'My plus one forever': Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée’s adorable pictures with Sara Tendulkar – IN PICSTrendingCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed Salah'My plus one forever': Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée’s adorable pictures with Sara Tendulkar – IN PICSTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 14, 2025, 14:09 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeArjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandhok, granddaughter of Mumbai entrepreneur Ravi Ghai. The intimate ceremony was attended by close family and friends. Sister Sara Tendulkar shared heartwarming photos with her future sister-in-law, expressing her joy. Saaniya is an entrepreneur and animal welfare advocate, founding Mr. PAWS, a pet care brand. Arjun Tendulkar and Sara Tendulkar with Saaniya Chandok (Image: X) Cricket fans across India were surprised when news of Arjun Tendulkar’s engagement to Saaniya Chandok surfaced. Arjun, son of cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar, exchanged rings with Saaniya — granddaughter of well-known Mumbai entrepreneur Ravi Ghai — on Wednesday.The engagement was held in an intimate ceremony attended by close ones. Once the news broke, social media buzzed with excitement and reactions.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!One post by Arjun's sister Sara Tendulkar, in which she shared adorable pictures with her future sister-in-law, has gone viral.Saaniya Chandok Sara Tendulkar (Instagram)Sara posted multiple photos with Saaniya with the caption: "My plus one forever."Arjun Tendulkar represents Goa in domestic cricket and has also played for the Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League.He began his cricketing career with Mumbai in the 2020/21 season, debuting in a T20 match against Haryana.Sara Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandok (Instagram)Before that, he represented Mumbai at the junior level and was part of the India U19 squad. In the 2022/23 season, he moved to Goa, where he made his First-Class and List A debuts.Who is Saaniya Chandhok?Saaniya hails from the renowned Ghai family. Her grandfather, Ravi Ghai, is the chairman of the Graviss Group, a prominent conglomerate in Mumbai’s food and hospitality sector, best known for ventures like the InterContinental Hotel and the Brooklyn Creamery (which manages Baskin-Robbins’ operations in India).PollWhat is your reaction to Arjun Tendulkar's engagement to Saaniya Chandok?Excited for them!Surprised but happy.Not a fan of the match.Indifferent.Saaniya, an entrepreneur and animal welfare advocate, is the founder of Mr. PAWS, a Mumbai-based pet care brand specializing in grooming, skincare, and wellness services for pets. She is also a certified veterinary technician, having completed the WVS ABC programme.Saaniya’s Instagram account is private, with just 805 followers, among them Arjun and Sara Tendulkar.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Spotted! Sachin Tendulkar with his future daughter-in-law Saaniya Chandok
Sachin Tendulkar and his family, including future daughter-in-law Saaniya Chandok, were recently photographed performing a pooja at home. Saaniya, engaged to Arjun Tendulkar, is the granddaughter of businessman Ravi Ghai and a director at Mr. Paws Pet Spa & Store LLP. The intimate gathering highlights the growing bond between the Tendulkar and Ghai families, offering a glimpse into pre-wedding celebrations.

Sachin Tendulkar with his future daughter-in-law Saaniya ChandokSpotted! Sachin Tendulkar with his future daughter-in-law Saaniya ChandokTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 14, 2025, 13:57 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSachin Tendulkar and his family, including future daughter-in-law Saaniya Chandok, were recently photographed performing a pooja at home. Saaniya, engaged to Arjun Tendulkar, is the granddaughter of businessman Ravi Ghai and a director at Mr. Paws Pet Spa & Store LLP. The intimate gathering highlights the growing bond between the Tendulkar and Ghai families, offering a glimpse into pre-wedding celebrations. Saaniya Chandok with Sara Tendulkar (X) New pictures on Instagram are offering fans a rare and intimate glimpse into cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar’s family life. The images show Sachin performing a pooja at home, joined by his wife Anjali, daughter Sara, and his future daughter-in-law, Saaniya Chandok.The family gathering is a quiet, personal moment, yet it has captured the attention of cricket fans and social media users alike. The presence of Saaniya alongside the Tendulkars highlights the growing bond between the two families ahead of her engagement to Arjun Tendulkar.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Saaniya Chandok, granddaughter of prominent Mumbai industrialist Ravi Ghai, comes from one of the city’s most respected business families. The Ghai family owns the InterContinental hotel and Brooklyn Creamery ice cream brand and has extensive interests in hospitality and food businesses through Graviss Group.Sara Tendulkar with her future sister-in-law Saaniya Chandok (on Sara’s right, wearing a green kurti) and other friends and family. Despite her influential family background, Saaniya has maintained a low public profile, quietly supporting family ventures while preparing for her life alongside Arjun Tendulkar.Also Read: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok – What’s the net worth of her family’s business empire? The engagement between Saaniya and Arjun was reportedly a private affair, attended only by close family and friends. Arjun, a 25-year-old left-arm fast-bowling all-rounder, has carved his own path in cricket, representing Goa in domestic competitions and playing for Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League. While he has followed in his father’s footsteps on the cricket field, Saaniya’s presence brings a different dimension to the Tendulkar household, symbolising the merging of two prominent Mumbai families.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics.

Cricket's Rs 1,400 crore question: Should India even play Pakistan in the Asia Cup?
Pakistan’s latest meltdown against West Indies is another instance of their struggles across formats. The Asia Cup in UAE which could see them clash vs India thrice, provided both qualify for final, was meant to trigger hype and boost the broadcasters’ revenue. However, with Pakistan’s form and record vs India being so poor, one wonders how enthused cricket fans will be about what was a marquee match not too long ago
Cricket's Rs 1,400 crore question: Should India even play Pakistan in the Asia Cup? | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsCricket's Rs 1,400 crore question: Should India even play Pakistan in the Asia Cup?TrendingCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCommonwealth GamesVece PaesArjun Tendulkar Net WorthIrfan PathanSaaniya Chandok Net WorthAkash DeepIPL TradeWho is Saaniya ChandokArjun Tendulkar EngagementMohamed SalahCricket's Rs 1,400 crore question: Should India even play Pakistan in the Asia Cup?K Shriniwas Rao / TNN / Updated: Aug 14, 2025, 13:58 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePakistan’s latest meltdown against West Indies is another instance of their struggles across formats. The Asia Cup in UAE which could see them clash vs India thrice, provided both qualify for final, was meant to trigger hype and boost the broadcasters’ revenue. However, with Pakistan’s form and record vs India being so poor, one wonders how enthused cricket fans will be about what was a marquee match not too long ago India could meet Pakistan thrice in the Asia Cup that will be played in September in the UAE. The debate over whether India should face Pakistan in the upcoming Asia Cup has divided opinion across the country, reflecting ongoing discussions about one of cricket’s most storied rivalries.Proponents argue that an India–Pakistan clash should proceed, asserting that the intense rivalry significantly boosts revenues, adding substantially to the coffers like no other cricket match-up. They contend that India, often regarded as the subcontinent’s ‘big brother’, has a role in financially sustaining other cricket-playing nations.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Conversely, opponents maintain that engaging in cricket matches with a nation they were at war with merely months earlier is untenable. They argue that there is no compelling reason to schedule cricket fixtures while broader bilateral tensions between the two neighbours remain unresolved.Amidst this heated debate, a common understanding among fans persists that the India–Pakistan rivalry remains cricket’s most heated and eagerly anticipated encounter. However, this perception warrants re-examination.Is the rivalry still as fierce? India and Pakistan last contested a Test match 18 years ago. Over the past 15 years, they have played 16 One Day Internationals (ODIs), with India securing twelve victories, and thirteen T20 matches, of which India has won ten.A snapshot of Pakistan's win-loss record since the 2022 T20 World Cup. The International Cricket Council (ICC) marketed the India–Pakistan match as the premier clash at the T20 World Cup in the United States last year. In the tournament, Pakistan not only lost to India but also to the hosts and the minor team USA in the first round.On Tuesday, the West Indies achieved a comprehensive victory over Pakistan in the third ODI in Tarouba, bowling them out for a mere 92 runs, underscoring the team’s ongoing struggles. Apart from home and away wins against Bangladesh earlier this year, the national team’s ODI performances have been lacklustre over the past two years.These statistics resurface regularly. Considering that India and Pakistan could potentially meet three times in the Asia Cup – during the league stage, the Super Four, and potentially the final – one wonders if it will live up to its anticipated status.India will meet Pakistan on September 14 in the group stage of the Asia Cup 2025.From an economic perspective, the India–England and India–Australia fixtures have seen exponential growth in recent years. For instance, the recent Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy, a five-Test series, recorded the highest-ever viewership numbers for digital broadcasts. Furthermore, the 2017 Border–Gavaskar series in India, followed by the 2024 leg in Australia, have become the highest-grossing bilateral cricket events to date.For the India–Pakistan rivalry to achieve similar financial success, the quality of cricket between the two nations would need a significant improvement. The primary benefits of India participating in the Asia Cup are twofold: firstly, assured financial gains for cricket boards across the subcontinent through media rights revenue; secondly, fostering goodwill ahead of discussions when India hosts the 2026 T20 World Cup.India vs Pakistan in last 15 yearsODI Matches: 17India wins: 12Pakistan wins: 4No Result: 1T20I matches: 13India wins: 10Pakistan wins: 3With media rights revenues valued at approximately Rs 1,400 crore for three tournaments (plus approximately Rs 290 crore from ground rights), each cricket board is guaranteed a minimum of Rs 290 to 332 crore over six years – an outcome unattainable without India’s involvement. In the context of the T20 World Cup, media rights revenues are several times higher than those of the Asia Cup.Ultimately, it is the financial stakes of the India–Pakistan match that remain high, while on-field competitiveness has diminished to a mere myth.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4.
