Elon Musk’s AI company will make Grok chatbot more accessible, here’s how
Elon Musk criticizes OpenAI's deviation from mission and advocates AI accessibility for all. Musk announces xAI open sourcing Grok chatbot. OpenAI CEO Altman takes a dig at Musk's chatbot. Musk, obviously didn't like the jab and replied with a long-ish message saying “GPT-4 is about as funny as a screendoor on a submarine.”
Elon Musk’s AI company will make Grok chatbot more accessible, here’s how - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOITechGadgets NewsAINew BingTech NewsGadgetsReviewsTop GadgetsSlideshowsVideosHow toFeaturedWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsGadgets NewsElon Musk’s AI company will make Grok chatbot more accessible, here’s howTrendingGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesThis story is from March 11, 2024Elon Musk’s AI company will make Grok chatbot more accessible, here’s howTOI Tech Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Mar 11, 2024, 15:11 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us Elon Musk criticizes OpenAI's deviation from mission and advocates AI accessibility for all. Musk announces xAI open sourcing Grok chatbot. OpenAI CEO Altman takes a dig at Musk's chatbot. Musk, obviously didn't like the jab and replied with a long-ish message saying “GPT-4 is about as funny as a screendoor on a submarine.”  Elon Musk has been extremely critical of ChatGPT maker OpenAI for deviating from its mission to develop AI for the benefit of humanity and taking a profit-making path. He has advocated that artificial intelligence (AI) should be accessible for all, and he has now announced that his AI startup xAI will open source Grok chatbot this week.“This week, @xAI will open source Grok,” Musk said in a post on X (formerly Twitter).In simpler words, open-sourcing a software, like a chatbot, means that the software projects are redistributable as all source code is accessible by everyone. One of the advantages of having open source software is that it provides flexibility to an enterprise to have multiple ways of fixing a problem rather than waiting for an internal team to provide a solution.“OpenAI is a lie”Meanwhile, a user suggested that OpenAI should do the same.“OpenAI should do the same if they are ‘open’ that is,” the user said. Musk replied, “OpenAI is a lie.”Musk wants AI technology to be open-source Musk had floated the idea of open-sourcing AI during a podcast in November last year. In a podcast with Lex Fridman, Musk suggested that he likes the idea of open-source AI. “I am generally in favour of open sourcing, like biassed towards open sourcing,” he said.His comments came soon after his AI company called xAI released Grok, its chatbot, which reportedly took four months to build. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman was quick to take a dig at this and shared a post in which he built Grok with a single prompt on GPT Builder."GPTs can save a lot of effort:” he said.Musk, obviously didn't like the jab and replied with a long-ish message saying “GPT-4 is about as funny as a screendoor on a submarine.” About the AuthorTOI Tech DeskThe TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity.Read Moto G54 receives a price cut in India: Here’s how much the smartphone costs
The Moto G54 budget smartphone, with two variants, has received a price cut. The 8GB version is priced at Rs 13,999, and the 12GB variant is selling at Rs 15,999. It features a 6.5-inch FHD+ display, 120Hz refresh rate, and a 50MP main sensor.
Moto G54 receives a price cut in India: Here’s how much the smartphone costs - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOITechGadgets NewsAINew BingTech NewsGadgetsReviewsTop GadgetsSlideshowsVideosHow toFeaturedWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsGadgets NewsMoto G54 receives a price cut in India: Here’s how much the smartphone costsTrendingGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesThis story is from March 11, 2024Moto G54 receives a price cut in India: Here’s how much the smartphone costsTOI Tech Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Mar 11, 2024, 15:06 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us The Moto G54 budget smartphone, with two variants, has received a price cut. The 8GB version is priced at Rs 13,999, and the 12GB variant is selling at Rs 15,999. It features a 6.5-inch FHD+ display, 120Hz refresh rate, and a 50MP main sensor.  If you have been planing to purchase a budget smartphone, then you can consider buying the Moto G54. Launched last year, the Moto G54 comes in two variants and both of them have receives a price cut. The Moto G54 features an FHD+ display and is powered by a MediaTek Dimensity chipset. New priceMotorola launched the Moto G54 smartphone in September last year.The company launched the two variants of the smartphone — 8GB+128GB and 12GB+256GB priced at Rs 15,999 and Rs 18,999 respectively. The 8GB version of the smartphone has got a price cut of Rs 2,000 and it can now be purchased at Rs 13,999. On the other hand, the 12GB variant has got a price cut of Rs 3,000 and it is now selling at Rs 15,999. Customers can purchase the Moto G54 in Mint Green, Midnight Blue and Pearl Blue colour options. Moto G54 specificationsMoto G54 comes with a 6.5-inch FHD+ display with 1080x2400 pixel resolution. The display offers 120Hz refresh rate and up to 560 nits of peak brightness level. The display of the smartphone is protected with a layer of Panda glass on top. The affordable Motorola smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 7020 chipset. The smartphone comes in two variants — 8GB+128GB and 12GB+256GB. Users can further expand the storage by adding a microSD card to up to 1TB.Moto G54 runs Android 13 operating system topped with company’s own layer of My UX. The smartphone sports a dual rear camera with 50MP main sensor with f/1.8 aperture, 8MP ultra wide angle lens with f/2.2 aperture. Front is home to a 16MP front camera with f/2.4 aperture. The smartphone comes equipped with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor. Moto G54 comes with IP54 rating which makes the smartphone resistant to dust and splash. The smartphone is backed by a 6000 mAh battery with 30W fast charging support.About the AuthorTOI Tech DeskThe TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity.Read How Apple’s Find My app ‘cost’ a US city millions of dollars
Denver city pays $3.76 million in damages due to a wrongful raid caused by Apple's Find My app. An elderly woman's home was mistakenly raided by the police while searching for a stolen truck loaded with guns, ammo, and cash, as reported by CNN. Ruby Johnson filed a lawsuit against Detective Gary Staab and Sgt. Gregory Buschy.
How Apple’s Find My app ‘cost’ a US city millions of dollars - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOITechGadgets NewsAINew BingTech NewsGadgetsReviewsTop GadgetsSlideshowsVideosHow toFeaturedWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsGadgets NewsHow Apple’s Find My app ‘cost’ a US city millions of dollarsTrendingGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesThis story is from March 11, 2024How Apple’s Find My app ‘cost’ a US city millions of dollarsTOI Tech Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Mar 11, 2024, 14:49 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us Denver city pays $3.76 million in damages due to a wrongful raid caused by Apple's Find My app. An elderly woman's home was mistakenly raided by the police while searching for a stolen truck loaded with guns, ammo, and cash, as reported by CNN. Ruby Johnson filed a lawsuit against Detective Gary Staab and Sgt. Gregory Buschy.  Apple's Find My app has cost the city of Denver, US $3.76 million in compensation and damages. In 2022, the city’s police wrongly raided and ransacked an elderly woman's home looking for a stolen truck and guns. According to a report by CNN, Denver police were seeking to recover a stolen truck loaded with guns, ammo and cash. For this, the police used Apple's Find My technology on another iPhone to locate the vehicle.However, the police picked the wrong house out of a fairly wide area to storm in and catch the thieves. Due to this misplaced raid, 78-year-old Ruby Johnson filed a lawsuit against the police. As compensation, the city will be paying Johnson a $3.76 million award. Moreover, the defendant officers — Detective Gary Staab and Sgt. Gregory Buschy — were also sued as an individual. Denver police had previously cleared both men of wrongdoing, but the jury disagreed.How Apple’s Find My app played a roleThe American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) brought the case on behalf of Johnson. The lawsuit mentioned that the raid was conducted based on an “alleged location ping from an iPhone's Find My app that the officers did not understand and for which they had no training." As per the complaint, the police relied on a "Find My" ping from an iPhone 11 that was probably still in the stolen truck. However, the area identified included parts of six other properties across parts of four city blocks.In a statement, Johnson's attorney Tim Macdonald said: “We are disturbed by the lack of training or policy changes and hope that the amount of the punitive damages award will send a strong message that the police department must take seriously the constitutional rights of its residents.” The ACLU and the jury concluded that the two police officers who ordered the raid had no reason to single out Johnson's house as the target. Also, the officers have to pay nearly $1.25 million each in punitive and compensatory damages. A Denver District Court clerk noted that the city has not yet filed an appeal of the verdict.About the AuthorTOI Tech DeskThe TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity.Read Former Activision boss reportedly wants to buy TikTok
Bobby Kotick, former head of Activision Blizzard, may buy TikTok amid its potential US ban. A bill to sell TikTok is introduced, backed by President Biden. Kotick discussed acquisition with OpenAI head. Activision Blizzard faced a lawsuit. Concerns about data privacy and ties to China persist. TikTok urges American users to support it.
Former Activision boss reportedly wants to buy TikTok - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOITechGadgets NewsAINew BingTech NewsGadgetsReviewsTop GadgetsSlideshowsVideosHow toFeaturedWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsGadgets NewsFormer Activision boss reportedly wants to buy TikTokTrendingGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesThis story is from March 11, 2024Former Activision boss reportedly wants to buy TikTokTOI Tech Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Mar 11, 2024, 14:38 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us Bobby Kotick, former head of Activision Blizzard, may buy TikTok amid its potential US ban. A bill to sell TikTok is introduced, backed by President Biden. Kotick discussed acquisition with OpenAI head. Activision Blizzard faced a lawsuit. Concerns about data privacy and ties to China persist. TikTok urges American users to support it.  Bobby Kotick, the former head of Activision Blizzard, is reportedly considering buying TikTok, as the app could be banned in the United States. The Wall Street Journal reports that Kotick has talked to ByteDance, the company that owns TikTok, about buying the app, which could cost hundreds of billions of dollars.This comes as US lawmakers introduce a new bill that would make ByteDance sell TikTok within six months or stop it from being available in US app stores.President Joe Biden has said he would approve the bill if it passes in Congress.The Wall Street Journal report adds that Kotick, the head of OpenAI, Sam Altman, discussed teaming up to buy TikTok at a dinner last week. Kotick's interest in TikTok follows a rough end to his 30 years leading Activision Blizzard, which Microsoft acquired last year. The company faced a lawsuit saying it allowed sexual harassment and discrimination under Kotick's leadership. The Wall Street Journal also said Kotick knew about bad behaviour and didn't tell the board everything. Kotick was accused of harassment, but Activision Blizzard said the report was "misleading."Lawmakers are worried about data privacy and TikTok's ties to China. US President Biden, whose administration has banned the app already on state devices, has expressed his support for banning the app in the US. However, former President Donald Trump, who once wanted to ban TikTok, has changed his mind, saying a ban would help TikTok's rivals, like Facebook and YouTube. As the bill against TikTok gains support, the app has asked its American users to speak up for it, sending messages telling users to call their representatives. The bill, which passed a committee last week, is expected to be approved when the House votes on Wednesday. If it passes, it will then go to the Senate, and then the bill will be signed by the President of the US.Former Activision boss reportedly wants to buy TikTokAbout the AuthorTOI Tech DeskThe TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity.Read Why Earth Sciences minister Rijiju is upset with this European IT company

Kiren Rijiju: Why Earth Sciences minister Rijiju is upset with this European IT company | - Times of IndiaEditionININUSSign InTOITechGadgets NewsAINew BingTech NewsGadgetsReviewsTop GadgetsSlideshowsVideosHow toFeaturedWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsGadgets NewsWhy Earth Sciences minister Rijiju is upset with this European IT companyTrendingGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesGarena Free Fire Max CodesWordleDiljit DosanjhTapswap Daily CodesTomarket Secret Daily ComboRatan Tata DeathTapcoin Daily Bounty CardsGenshin Impact CodesBlade Ball CodesMemeFi Daily CodesThis story is from March 11, 2024Why Earth Sciences minister Rijiju is upset with this European IT companyTOI Tech Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Mar 11, 2024, 14:39 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us  PTI photo Earth Sciences Minister Kiren Rijiju is reportedly upset with the French IT company Atos. Reason is said to be delay in the delivery of two supercomputers by the French company to Indian weather forecasting institutes. According to a report in news agency PTI, the Earth Sciences Ministry had ordered two supercomputers worth $100 million from French firm Eviden, of the Atos Group, last year to enhance the computing capabilities of its institutions -- the National Centre for Medium Range Weather Forecasting (NCMRWF) and the Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM)."I am more upset because the target we set was December. The Union Cabinet had already approved purchasing the supercomputer. We have only four petaflop capacity. We want to install up to 18 petaflop capacity," Rijiju told PTI in a video interview.He said that the French company ran into some financial trouble and wanted the government to make payment to its subsidiary.Minister says that the delay is causing him "worry"Rijiju said that the delay has caused him lots of worry as the company has overshot the timeline. "But I think we will sort it out soon," he said, adding that the government wanted to be "very correct in our position legally"."We are ready to release the money because we want the machine immediately. The only problem is the amount is not small. So if we pay now, if the company is bankrupt or something happens, who will bail out," the minister said.Rijiju further added that the government was taking some steps to speed up the delivery of the supercomputer but did not elaborate. "But I hope the French government will also intervene because we have a good understanding and a very good relationship with the French government."Since it is a high-cost equipment, we want to ensure that the transaction happens duly and properly," he said."From outside, everything's ready. It is only the problem with the main company. They want us to pay their subsidiary. We will pay only to a company whom we have entered an MoU with," Rijiju said.The supercomputing system, based on Eviden's BullSequana XH2000, is said to have a combined power capacity of up to 21.3 petaflops.Supercomputer at IITMThe supercomputer at the Pune-based IITM will provide 13 petaflops of computing power for atmosphere and climate research. As per the PTI report, it will integrate 3,000 CPU nodes using AMD EPYC 7643 processors and 26 GPU nodes through NVIDIA A100 Tensor Core GPUs. The system will benefit from the NVIDIA Quantum InfiniBand networking platform with In-Network Computing, 3PB all flash and 29PB disk-based DDN EXAScaler ES400NVX2 storage and Micron high-technology memory.The existing computing facility at NCMRWF is 2.8 petaflops and at IITM is 4 petaflops, respectively.About the AuthorTOI Tech DeskThe TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA Photostories  From earning Rs 500 per month to making it to the Forbes list, having a net worth of approximately Rs 300 crores and more: Rags to riches story of Kapil SharmaBigg Boss 18: Confirmed list of the contestants of Salman Khan hosted controversial showSchengen visa denials: 5 countries with the highest rejection rates8 animals that help Earth heal and howFrom keeping his second marriage under wraps to converting to Islam; A look at Bigg Boss 18 contestant Vivian Dsena's Personal Life revelations5 countries with the best anti-aircraft missile systems in the world5 psychology tips to be more mature in life and relationshipsWeekly Horoscope: October 14th to 20th, 20245 most valuable stamps in the world6 mantras that are believed to help students develop focus and concentrationFrom Nidhi Shah to Kunwar Amarjeet Singh: Famous stars exit 'Anupamaa''Petta' to 'Vettaiyan': Opening day box office collection of Rajinikanth's last five films123Hot PicksPakistan SCO SummitAir India Bomb ThreatUS Election Timeline 2024Christopher ColumbusSpaceX Starship LaunchDonald Trump Assassination AttemptStock Market TodayTOP TRENDINGSpaceX Starship LaunchLawrence BishnoiPapankusha EkadashiBarron TrumpPopular School in MumbaiDiddy ListTaylor SwiftBaba Siddique MurderDonald TrumpHassan NasrallahTrending StoriesIn SectionEntire WebsiteApple smart glasses and camera-equipped AirPods may launch in 2027Anand Mahindra celebrates Elon Musk's SpaceX starship milestone: ‘.... MPPSC admit card 2025 for State Engineering Service exam released at mppsc.gov.in: Check direct link to download hall ticket here
Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission has released admit cards for State Engineering Service Exam 2025. The exam is scheduled for August 24, 2025. Candidates can download hall tickets from mppsc.gov.in. Applicants must check details like roll number and exam center. A printed admit card and photo ID are mandatory. Candidates should reach the center 30 minutes early.
MPPSC admit card 2025 for State Engineering Service exam released at mppsc.gov.in: Check direct link to download hall ticket here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsMPPSC admit card 2025 for State Engineering Service exam released at mppsc.gov.in: Check direct link to download hall ticket hereTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultMPPSC admit card 2025 for State Engineering Service exam released at mppsc.gov.in: Check direct link to download hall ticket hereTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 14:06 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMadhya Pradesh Public Service Commission has released admit cards for State Engineering Service Exam 2025. The exam is scheduled for August 24, 2025. Candidates can download hall tickets from mppsc.gov.in. Applicants must check details like roll number and exam center. A printed admit card and photo ID are mandatory. Candidates should reach the center 30 minutes early.  The Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) has officially released the admit card for the State Engineering Service (SES) Exam 2025. Scheduled to be held on August 24, 2025, the SES exam is a crucial opportunity for engineering graduates aspiring to secure government positions in Madhya Pradesh. Candidates who have successfully registered for the exam can now download their hall tickets from the official MPPSC website. The admit card serves as a mandatory document for exam entry and carries important details including roll number, exam center, timings, and guidelines. With the examination approaching, candidates are advised to check all details carefully, ensure they meet the reporting requirements, and prepare for the test in line with official instructions.How to download the MPPSC SES admit card 2025Here is how candidates can download their MPPSC SES hall tickets online:Visit the official MPPSC website: mppsc.gov.in.Click on the link labeled “State Engineering Service Exam 2025 Admit Card.”Enter your application number and date of birth.Submit the details to access your hall ticket.Download and print the admit card for exam day.Direct link to download MPPSC admit card.Details mentioned on the admit cardAfter downloading the MPPSC admit card, candidates are advised to check all the details mentioned on it carefully. The following information will be mentioned in the hall ticket:Candidate’s name and photographRoll number and shift detailsExam date, time, and reporting timeExam center addressInstructions to follow on the exam dayExam day guidelinesCandidates appearing for the MPPSC SES exam are advised to follow the instructions provided below on the day of examination. Carry a printed copy of the admit card.Bring a valid photo ID (Aadhar, voter ID, passport, or driving license).Reach the exam center at least 30 minutes early.Follow all instructions mentioned in the admit card.For more updates and information, candidates can visit the official MPPSC website: mppsc.gov.in.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousYou’re probably a hater if you’re one of these zodiac signsastrologyHow to set up a planted aquarium at home MCC NEET UG counselling 2025: Round 1 college reporting extended till this date, check official notice here
The Medical Counselling Committee extended the deadline for NEET UG 2025 counselling's first round. Candidates now have more time to complete admission formalities. This includes document verification and fee payment at allotted colleges. Those who secured seats must report by the new deadline. Round 2 counselling is open for those without seats in Round 1. Check mcc.nic.
MCC NEET UG counselling 2025: Round 1 college reporting extended till this date, check official notice here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsMCC NEET UG counselling 2025: Round 1 college reporting extended till this date, check official notice hereTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultMCC NEET UG counselling 2025: Round 1 college reporting extended till this date, check official notice hereTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 13:31 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Medical Counselling Committee extended the deadline for NEET UG 2025 counselling's first round. Candidates now have more time to complete admission formalities. This includes document verification and fee payment at allotted colleges. Those who secured seats must report by the new deadline. Round 2 counselling is open for those without seats in Round 1. Check mcc.nic.  The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has announced an extension for the reporting deadline for Round 1 of NEET UG 2025 counselling. This move comes as many candidates sought additional time to complete their admission formalities, including document verification and fee payment, at their allotted medical or dental colleges. Candidates who have secured seats in this round must now report by the revised deadline to confirm their admissions; failure to do so may result in forfeiture of seats. Students who were not allotted a seat in Round 1 still have the opportunity to participate in Round 2 counselling. The MCC has provided detailed instructions regarding eligibility, registration, and seat allotment for the next round. Candidates are advised to check mcc.nic.in regularly for official updates.Seat allotment and reporting detailsRound 1 seat allotment results for NEET UG 2025 have been released on the MCC official website. Candidates must log in using their NEET UG application credentials to view their allotment status. Once the seat is confirmed, students are required to complete the reporting process at the allotted college, which includes submission of required documents, identity verification, and payment of admission fees. The extension provides additional time for candidates to resolve logistical challenges, such as travel arrangements or obtaining necessary certificates. Reporting on time is mandatory, as any delay can lead to loss of the allotted seat.The official revised schedule released by MCC can be checked here.NEET UG round 2 counselling and eligibility Candidates not allotted seats in Round 1 or who wish to upgrade their seat are eligible for Round 2 of NEET UG counselling. Fresh registration may be required for this round, and students must carefully follow the MCC guidelines to participate. The step-by-step process includes choice filling, seat allotment confirmation, and reporting to the allotted college. Eligibility criteria, including reservation norms and previously allotted seats, are clearly outlined by MCC to ensure transparency. Round 2 provides an important opportunity for students to secure seats in colleges of their preference.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousHow to set up a planted aquarium at home and the types of fish to keep: 10-step guideLifestyle'Coolie': Why did this PhD student from Tamil Nadu refuse to receive her degree from Governor RN Ravi at MSU convocation?
Jean Joseph, a PhD graduate, protested at Manonmaniam Sundaranar University's convocation by refusing to accept her degree from Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi. She cited Ravi's lack of contribution to Tamil Nadu's development and disregard for Tamil identity as reasons. Her act has ignited discussions about student autonomy and political expression within academic ceremonies.
Why This Tamil Nadu PhD Student Refused to Take Her Degree From Governor RN Ravi at MSU Convocation | - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsWhy did this PhD student from Tamil Nadu refuse to receive her degree from Governor RN Ravi at MSU convocation?TrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultWhy did this PhD student from Tamil Nadu refuse to receive her degree from Governor RN Ravi at MSU convocation?TOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 12:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeJean Joseph, a PhD graduate, protested at Manonmaniam Sundaranar University's convocation by refusing to accept her degree from Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi. She cited Ravi's lack of contribution to Tamil Nadu's development and disregard for Tamil identity as reasons. Her act has ignited discussions about student autonomy and political expression within academic ceremonies.  A bold act of protest at Manonmaniam Sundaranar University’s 32nd convocation has become a talking point across Tamil Nadu. Jean Joseph, a PhD graduate in Human Resource Management, chose not to receive her degree from Tamil Nadu Governor R N Ravi, challenging the long-standing tradition of students collecting degrees directly from the Governor, who is also the university’s chancellor.Convocation ceremony in focusThe convocation, held at V.O.C. Auditorium, conferred degrees to 37,376 students from 104 affiliated colleges and the university, spanning bachelor’s, master’s, MPhil, and PhD programmes. 759 graduates were present to receive their degrees in person, including 650 PhD scholars, and 109 medallists were honoured for academic excellence. The ceremony featured a convocation address by A P Dimri, Director of the Indian Institute of Geomagnetism, under the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India.Traditionally, students pose for photographs with the Governor after receiving their certificates. In a surprising move, Joseph accepted her degree from Vice-Chancellor N Chandrasekar instead, bypassing Governor Ravi entirely.A stand for choice and Tamil identityDuring the convocation, Joseph bypassed Governor R N Ravi and chose to receive her degree from Vice-Chancellor N Chandrasekar, breaking with the traditional practice of posing with the Governor. Explaining her decision to TNN, she said she acted “only as a way to register protest against the governor, who has not contributed anything to the development of the state and has shown he is against the welfare of the people of Tamil Nadu.” Adding to this, she mentioned that she “believes in the 'Dravidian' model of governance.”She added further in a statement to ANI, highlighting her perspective on student choice and respect for Tamil culture: “I believe the Governor has done nothing for Tamil Nadu or the Tamil language. Many others, such as the Chief Minister or the Education Minister, are more qualified to present degrees. It should be the student’s choice. My fellow students appreciated my decision. If it were wrong, no one would have congratulated me. I don’t want to take my degree from someone who does not respect our land, language, and identity.”Joseph emphasised that her protest was political in principle, not personal, and many students reportedly supported her for taking a stand for Tamil identity, language, and governance.Academic journeyJean Joseph has an impressive academic background. She completed her B.Com at Hindu College, Nagercoil, followed by an MCA at Mepco College, Sivakasi, before earning her PhD in Human Resource Management from MSU. Her research focused on human resource strategies and organisational development, preparing her for a career in academia and organisational consulting.Reactions and wider debateThe incident has sparked discussions across campuses about student autonomy, ceremonial traditions, and political expression. As reported by TNN, BJP’s Tamil Nadu president, K Annamalai, criticised the move as “unnecessary and useless drama” aimed at political gain. Joseph’s husband, Rajan, serves as the district student wing secretary of the DMK, adding a political dimension to her action.Many educators and students see her decision as an example of how ceremonial traditions can intersect with political awareness and personal principles, particularly in a state like Tamil Nadu, where student activism and regional pride have long been influential.Joseph’s stand has become a reference point for discussions on whether students should have the freedom to choose from whom they receive their degrees, a debate that could shape convocation practices in the years to come.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousAlia Bhatt’s hairstylist warns against straightening damp hair: Know why we agree with himLifestyleZodiac signs Independence Day 2025 speech for students: Top August 15 topics to prep for your school morning assembly tomorrow
This Independence Day 2025 speech guide for students helps craft impactful school assembly addresses. It blends history, patriotism and current issues, offering ten engaging August 15 topics — from unsung freedom fighters to India 2047 — to inspire peers, promote critical thinking and make Independence Day celebrations more meaningful and memorable.
Independence Day 2025 Speech for Students: Best 10 Topics for August 15 School Assembly | - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsIndependence Day 2025 speech for students: Top August 15 topics to prep for your school morning assembly tomorrowTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultSBI Clerk WaitlistMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingCGBSE Supplementary Exam ResultsUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 speech for students: Top August 15 topics to prep for your school morning assembly tomorrowTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 12:26 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThis Independence Day 2025 speech guide for students helps craft impactful school assembly addresses. It blends history, patriotism and current issues, offering ten engaging August 15 topics — from unsung freedom fighters to India 2047 — to inspire peers, promote critical thinking and make Independence Day celebrations more meaningful and memorable. Independence Day 2025 speech ideas and tips for school students (Image: iStock) This August 15, India celebrates its 79th Independence Day — 78 years since we swapped the Union Jack for the tricolour and began scripting our own story. From Dandi to digital, the story has been one of grit, chaos, reinvention and the occasional leap of brilliance.Independence Day is not just a day off school or an excuse for laddoos. It is a microphone in your hand, a stage in front of your peers and a chance to prove that “freedom” is not just a chapter in a History textbook. Freedom is more than “freedom from” — it is “freedom to.” Freedom to rise above, to build something better, to belong to an India still under construction and here’s the thing: You — in those perfectly ironed uniforms — are both the legacy of those who dreamt and the future of those who dared.So, if you are speaking this morning, skip the predictable script everyone’s heard since the 90s. Don’t just recite 1947’s headlines, talk about the India you see, the India you want and the India you will help build. Make it personal, make it real and make it worth remembering.If you want your Independence Day speech to actually stand out, here are 10 ideas that can help you ditch the clichés and make every word count.1. Independence Beyond Flags and ParadesBest Independence Day speeches for students (Image: iStock)Freedom is more than flag-hoisting ceremonies and patriotic songs. It is about whether every citizen can speak, work and live without fear. Your speech can explore if our celebrations match the freedoms we promise ourselves and what role students can play in making independence a lived reality, not just an annual ritual.2. From Dandi to Digital: Has India Kept the Spirit Alive?Mahatma Gandhi’s salt march was about resisting economic injustice. Today, our battlegrounds are data privacy, unemployment and climate change. Draw parallels between past struggles and present-day challenges and question whether the courage of 1930 has truly travelled into the India of 2025 or if it is trapped in history textbooks.3. Patriotism vs Nationalism: Do We Know the Difference?High-schoolers often use these words interchangeably. Patriotism is love for your country; nationalism can become the demand for uncritical loyalty. A thoughtful speech can probe how blind nationalism risks silencing dissent and why a truly free India needs citizens who can question and improve it — not just cheer from the sidelines.4. Freedom to Dream, Freedom to FailWe celebrate billionaires and scientists but forget that the freedom to fail is also a marker of a free society. In school, failure can feel fatal; in life, it’s a stepping stone. Use your speech to connect academic pressures with the larger right to experiment, err, and evolve without stigma.5. India at 79: Still a Work in ProgressSeventy-eight years of independence have brought democracy, space missions, and economic growth — but also persistent inequality and corruption. Your audience is smart enough to handle nuance. Show them that loving your country means acknowledging its flaws, because blind adulation builds statues; honest critique builds nations.6. Youth as the Fourth Pillar of DemocracyShort Independence Day speech in English (Image: iStock)We’re told democracy rests on legislature, executive, and judiciary — but its future rests on young people who vote, volunteer, and hold power to account. Challenge your peers to see themselves as more than exam-takers; they are watchdogs, innovators, and future policymakers shaping India’s next 79 years.7. Unsung Heroes: Beyond the Textbook FiveMost school speeches name Gandhi, Nehru, Bhagat Singh, Bose, and Rani Laxmibai. But what about Matangini Hazra, Kanaklata Barua, or Peer Ali Khan? Bringing lesser-known freedom fighters into your speech honours their sacrifices and proves history is richer — and more inclusive — than the syllabus suggests.8. The Freedom to DisagreeIn 1947, the Constituent Assembly was a masterclass in debate and compromise. Today, social media turns disagreements into wars. Use this topic to argue why respecting different opinions is not weakness but the oxygen of democracy — and how students can practise that even in classroom discussions.9. Building the India We DeserveEvery Independence Day, leaders talk about the India of their dreams. But what about the India of your dreams? Paint a picture in your speech — cleaner streets, honest politics, fair opportunities — and remind your peers that the blueprint won’t come from Parliament alone. It starts in school corridors.10. Independence 2047: The Centenary QuestionWhen India turns 100 in 2047, most of today’s students will be in their 30s or 40s. What kind of country will we hand over to our children? Use your speech to make the centenary feel personal — not a far-off milestone, but a countdown that begins with the choices we make now.Remember, Independence Day speeches are more than ceremonial traditions — they are platforms to reignite the fire of patriotism and awaken a sense of responsibility in every Indian citizen. So, as you get ready for Independence Day 2025, pass on the legacy of our nation's heroes through your words because the future of India is shaped not only by its history but also by the way its youth carry the torch of freedom forward.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousZodiac signs who are known for their simplicityastrologyDO NOT ignore these warning signs of a heart SBI PO prelims result 2025 expected soon at sbi.co.in: Check where and how to download scorecards
State Bank of India will soon announce the Probationary Officer Preliminary Exam 2025 results. The exam took place on August 2nd, 4th, and 5th. Candidates can check their results on sbi.co.in. Qualified candidates will proceed to the Main Examination. The scorecard will contain candidate info, exam info, and qualifying status. Main Exam and Interview will determine final selection.

The exam took place on August 2nd, 4th, and 5th. Candidates can check their results on sbi.co.in. Qualified candidates will proceed to the Main Examination. The scorecard will contain candidate info, exam info, and qualifying status. Main Exam and Interview will determine final selection.  The State Bank of India (SBI) is expected to release the Probationary Officer (PO) Preliminary Exam 2025 results very soon. The Prelims exam was conducted across India on 2nd, 4th, and 5th August 2025, with thousands of candidates appearing at various centers. The result will be available on the official SBI website, sbi.co.in.SBI has not announced the exact date of result declaration. However, based on past trends, results are usually released within a few weeks of the exam. Candidates are advised to regularly check the SBI Careers page for official updates to avoid missing any announcements. Only candidates who qualify the Prelims will move to the Main Examination, which is the next stage in the recruitment process for SBI PO positions.How to check and download SBI PO resultOnce the result is released, candidates can follow these steps:Visit the SBI Careers PortalGo to the Recruitment Results page on the official SBI website.Look for “Probationary Officers (Advertisement No: CRPD/PO/2024-25/22)” under the Prelims section.Fill in your Roll Number/Registration Number and Date of Birth accurately.Click Submit to see your result.Save a digital copy and take a printout for future reference, especially for Main exam registration.Details mentioned in SBI PO prelims scorecardAfter downloading the scorecards, candidates are advised to check all the details carefully. The following details will be mentioned in the SBI PO scorecards:Candidate Info: Name, Roll Number/Registration Number, Date of Birth, CategoryExam Info: Exam name, date, shift/sessionSection-wise Marks: English, Quantitative Aptitude, Reasoning AbilityTotal Marks: Marks obtained and maximum marksQualifying Status: Whether you cleared Prelims and eligible for Main ExamCut-off Marks: Category-wise section and overall cut-offsInstructions: Notes about Main Exam and preserving the scorecardWhat happens after the prelims?Candidates who qualify the Prelims are eligible to appear for the Main Exam, which is the next critical stage in SBI PO recruitment. The marks obtained in Prelims are only qualifying and do not count toward the final selection. The Main Exam, followed by the Group Exercise and Interview, determines the final selection of candidates.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. SSC exams 2025 OTR edit window opens today at ssc.gov.in: Check how to make changes online
The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has opened the One Time Registration (OTR) edit window from August 14 to 31, 2025, at ssc.gov.in for profile updates. Physical requests won’t be accepted. SSC has also postponed the CGL 2025 exam, initially set for August 13, to early September for a platform review; revised dates will be announced online.
SSC exams 2025 OTR edit window opens today at ssc.gov.in: Check how to make changes online - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsSSC exams 2025 OTR edit window opens today at ssc.gov.in: Check how to make changes onlineSSC exams 2025 OTR edit window opens today at ssc.gov.in: Check how to make changes onlineTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 10:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has opened the One Time Registration (OTR) edit window from August 14 to 31, 2025, at ssc.gov.in for profile updates. Physical requests won’t be accepted. SSC has also postponed the CGL 2025 exam, initially set for August 13, to early September for a platform review; revised dates will be announced online.  The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has announced that candidates can now edit their One Time Registration (OTR) profiles from today, August 14, until August 31, 2025. This facility is available for candidates who have already created OTR profiles and wish to update or correct their details ahead of upcoming recruitment examinations. Candidates with queries can reach out to the SSC help desk via telephone or email. The commission has clarified that requests submitted in physical form will not be accepted.What is OTR in SSC recruitment? One Time Registration (OTR) is a unified registration process that allows candidates to apply for multiple SSC recruitment examinations using a single account. By completing the OTR process, candidates can avoid registering separately for each exam. Creating an OTR profile involves the following steps:  Personal details: Enter candidate name, identification, and contact information   Password creation: Set a new login password   Additional details: Provide nationality, address, and educational qualifications   Declaration: Confirm all information submittedHow to make changes online Candidates can follow these steps to update their OTR profiles online:  Visit the official SSC website: ssc.gov.in   Log in using your OTR credentials.   Go to the ‘Edit OTR’ section.   Make the necessary corrections and save your changes.   Verify all information before final submission.  Note: Candidates are advised to ensure that all details are accurate before submission, as these will be used for future SSC examinations.SSC CGL exam 2025 postponedThe commission has also postponed the Combined Graduate Level Examination (CGLE) 2025, originally scheduled to begin on August 13, 2025. SSC stated that it will conduct a thorough review of the examination platform and operational readiness. The CGL exam is now expected to start in the first week of September 2025, and a revised schedule will be released on the official website.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. MP Board Exam 2026: MPBSE timetable for class 10, 12 exams released, check complete schedule here
The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education has released the 2026 exam timetable for Classes 10 and 12, anticipating over 15 lakh students. Theory exams will be held in the morning, while practicals are scheduled from February 10 to March 10, 2026. Students can download the official timetable from the MPBSE website for detailed subject-wise dates.

Theory exams will be held in the morning, while practicals are scheduled from February 10 to March 10, 2026. Students can download the official timetable from the MPBSE website for detailed subject-wise dates.  The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education (MPBSE) has officially released the examination timetable for the 2026 academic session for Class 10 and Class 12 students. With over 15 lakh students expected to appear, the timetable provides clarity on exam dates, subjects, and practical schedules, enabling better preparation and planning. All theory examinations will be conducted in the morning session from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM, while practical exams will be held in respective schools from February 10 to March 10, 2026. Students are advised to arrive at their exam centers at least 45 minutes early.MP Board Class 10 Exam Schedule 2026The examination schedule for MPBSE high school (class 10) students is as follows:DateDaySubjectFebruary 11TuesdayHindiFebruary 13ThursdayUrduFebruary 14FridayNSQFFebruary 17MondayEnglishFebruary 19WednesdaySanskritFebruary 20ThursdayMarathi, Gujarati, Punjabi, Sindhi, Painting, Music, Tabla, ComputerFebruary 24MondayMathematicsFebruary 27ThursdayScienceMarch 2MondaySocial ScienceMP Board Class 12 Exam Schedule 2026The higher secondary exams (class 12) for MPBSE students will be conducted by following the schedule below:DateDaySubjectFebruary 7FridayHindiFebruary 9SundayUrdu, MarathiFebruary 10MondayEnglishFebruary 13ThursdaySubject-specific exams as per official timetableFebruary 14FridaySubject-specific examsFebruary 17MondaySubject-specific examsFebruary 19WednesdaySubject-specific examsFebruary 20ThursdaySubject-specific examsFebruary 24MondaySubject-specific examsFebruary 27ThursdaySubject-specific examsMarch 3TuesdaySubject-specific examsHow to download the MPBSE official time tableStudents can download the official PDF from the official MPBSE website.Important Instructions:All theory exams are from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM.Students should reach exam centers at least 45 minutes early.Practical exams will be conducted in schools from February 10 to March 10, 2026.The timely release of the MPBSE 2026 exam timetable ensures that students and schools have adequate time to prepare, making the examination process more organized and stress-free.Ready to navigate global policies? BSF Head Constable Recruitment 2025: Notification released for 1,121 RO/RM posts, registration to begin on this date at bsf.gov.in
The Border Security Force (BSF) has announced recruitment for 1,121 Head Constable positions in Radio Operator (RO) and Radio Mechanic (RM) roles for 2025. Applications are open from August 24 to September 23, 2025, via the BSF portal. The selection process includes PST, PET, a written exam, skill test, document verification, and a medical examination.
BSF Head Constable Recruitment 2025: Notification released for 1,121 RO/RM posts, registration to begin on this date at bsf.gov.in - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsBSF Head Constable Recruitment 2025: Notification released for 1,121 RO/RM posts, registration to begin on this date at bsf.gov.inBSF Head Constable Recruitment 2025: Notification released for 1,121 RO/RM posts, registration to begin on this date at bsf.gov.inTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 09:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Border Security Force (BSF) has announced recruitment for 1,121 Head Constable positions in Radio Operator (RO) and Radio Mechanic (RM) roles for 2025. Applications are open from August 24 to September 23, 2025, via the BSF portal. The selection process includes PST, PET, a written exam, skill test, document verification, and a medical examination.  The Border Security Force (BSF) has released its 2025 recruitment notification for 1,121 Head Constable positions in the Radio Operator (RO) and Radio Mechanic (RM) categories, offering young aspirants an opportunity to serve at the nation’s frontline. With India’s emphasis on strengthening its paramilitary forces, these technical roles are critical for ensuring seamless communication and operational efficiency. The notification opens a structured pathway for eligible candidates to secure a stable career with attractive pay and benefits. Interested candidates can apply online from August 24 to September 23, 2025, via the official BSF portal bsf.gov.in.Total BSF Head Constable vacancy detailsAs per the official notification released, the vacancy breakup is as follows:Total Vacancies: 1,121Head Constable (Radio Operator): 910 postsHead Constable (Radio Mechanic): 211 postsThe distribution reflects BSF’s emphasis on communication roles and technical expertise within its ranks.Eligibility criteriaEducational Qualification:Radio Operator (RO): Candidates must have passed 12th standard with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, securing at least 60% marks. Strong knowledge in these subjects is crucial to handle communication systems effectively.Radio Mechanic (RM): Candidates should be 10th pass with a relevant ITI certificate, preparing them for hands-on work in radio and electronic maintenance.Age Limit: 18–25 years as of September 23, 2025Physical Standards: Minimum height, chest measurements, and physical endurance will be tested as part of the Physical Standard Test (PST) and Physical Efficiency Test (PET).Selection process for BSF head constable recruitmentThe selection process for BSF head constable posts consists of the following stages:Physical Standard Test (PST) – Measures height, chest, and weight standards.Physical Efficiency Test (PET) – Evaluates speed, endurance, and overall fitness.Written Examination – Objective MCQ-based test:Total Marks: 100Duration: 100 minutesNegative Marking: 0.25 marks per wrong answerTopics include general awareness, basic mathematics, reasoning, and technical subjects relevant to the post.Skill Test – Practical assessment for RO/RM candidates.Document Verification – Ensures candidate eligibility and authenticity of certificates.Medical Examination – Comprehensive medical check to confirm fitness for duty.Candidates must pass each stage to move to the next, making the process both competitive and rigorous.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. UP NEET UG counselling 2025: Round 1 seat allotment results to be released today at upneet.gov.in
UP NEET UG 2025 Round 1 seat allotment for 85% state quota MBBS/BDS seats will be announced today at upneet.gov.in. 32,230 candidates qualified, plus 1,531 added. Allotment letters can be downloaded Aug 18–23 and Aug 25–26. Refunds apply for timely withdrawal before Round 2 choice-filling; deposit and tuition fee refund policies vary for government and private colleges.

Allotment letters can be downloaded Aug 18–23 and Aug 25–26. Refunds apply for timely withdrawal before Round 2 choice-filling; deposit and tuition fee refund policies vary for government and private colleges.  The Directorate General of Medical Education and Training (DGME), Uttar Pradesh, will declare the first round seat allotment results for 85% state quota seats in the Uttar Pradesh National Eligibility cum Entrance Test Undergraduate (UP NEET UG) counselling 2025 today. Candidates who registered and submitted their choices for Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) and Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS) courses in government and private medical or dental colleges across the state will be able to check their allotment status at the official website: upneet.gov.in. Only applicants who completed document verification and paid the registration fee within the specified timeline were allowed to fill in their college preferences. As per the revised state merit list, a total of 32,230 candidates qualified for UP NEET UG 2025 counselling, with an additional 1,531 students added for state-level seat allocation this year. Candidates will be able to download their seat allotment letters from August 18 to 23 and again from August 25 to 26.How to check and download UP NEET UG 2025 Round 1 seat allotment resultCandidates can follow the steps below to check and download their UP NEET UG 2025 Round 1 seat allotment results:Visit the official website: upneet.gov.inOn the homepage, click on the link for “UP NEET UG 2025 Round 1 Seat Allotment Result”.Enter your login credentials.View your seat allotment status on the screen.Download and print the allotment letter for future reference. UP NEET UG 2025 Round 1 seat allotment: Refund policy If a candidate allotted a seat in the first round wishes to withdraw, they must submit their resignation up to two days before the choice-filling window for the second round opens. Those who resign before the free exit deadline will have their security deposit refunded. Students allotted government colleges will have all deposits except admission fees refunded, while those allotted private colleges will receive a tuition fee refund.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. CGBSE Class 10th,12th supplementary exam results expected to release soon: Check where and how to download scorecards, once released
The Chhattisgarh Board of Secondary Education (CGBSE) will soon release the 2025 Class 10 and 12 supplementary exam results on cgbse.nic.in and results.cg.nic.in. Exams were held in July. Students can download scorecards by entering roll numbers online. Class 10 students will choose academic streams, while Class 12 graduates can select undergraduate courses. Regularly check the website for updates.

Exams were held in July. Students can download scorecards by entering roll numbers online. Class 10 students will choose academic streams, while Class 12 graduates can select undergraduate courses. Regularly check the website for updates.  The Chhattisgarh Board of Secondary Education (CGBSE) is expected to release the supplementary examination results for Class 10th and Class 12th soon on its official websites: cgbse.nic.in and results.cg.nic.in. Students will be able to check and download their mark sheets for the CGBSE 10th and 12th supplementary examinations 2025 by logging in with their credentials, including roll numbers. The CGBSE Class 10th supplementary examinations for 2025 were held from July 9 to July 21, while the Class 12th supplementary examinations were conducted from July 8 to July 22. Once the results are announced, Class 10th students will be required to select their academic stream — humanities, commerce, or science, based on their interests. Class 12th students can choose from a range of undergraduate degree programmes according to their preferred field of study and career aspirations.How to check CGBSE 10th, 12th supplementary results 2025 Candidates can follow these steps to download their scorecards once released:  Visit the official website: cgbse.nic.in.   Navigate to the "Student Corner" section on the homepage.   Select the “High School Second Main Supplementary 2025” or “Higher Secondary Second Main Supplementary 2025” link, depending on your class.   Enter your roll number and the given captcha code.   View your CGBSE 10th or 12th supplementary results displayed on the screen.   Download and take a printout of the scorecard for future reference.   Students are advised to regularly check the official website for updates on the result declaration.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Maharashtra NEET UG counselling 2025 round 1 seat allotment list out: Check direct link to download here
The Maharashtra CET Cell has released the Round 1 seat allotment for NEET UG 2025, covering MBBS and BDS admissions in Maharashtra's medical colleges. Candidates can check their allotment status and download letters from cetcell.mahacet.org. Reporting to allotted colleges for document verification, fee payment, and status retention is scheduled from August 14-22, 2025, excluding August 15-16.
Maharashtra NEET UG counselling 2025 round 1 seat allotment list out: Check direct link to download here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsMaharashtra NEET UG counselling 2025 round 1 seat allotment list out: Check direct link to download hereMaharashtra NEET UG counselling 2025 round 1 seat allotment list out: Check direct link to download hereTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 08:48 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Maharashtra CET Cell has released the Round 1 seat allotment for NEET UG 2025, covering MBBS and BDS admissions in Maharashtra's medical colleges. Candidates can check their allotment status and download letters from cetcell.mahacet.org. Reporting to allotted colleges for document verification, fee payment, and status retention is scheduled from August 14-22, 2025, excluding August 15-16.  The Maharashtra State Common Entrance Test (CET) Cell has officially announced the Round 1 seat allotment result for NEET UG 2025. This list is valid for admissions under the Centralised Admission Process (CAP) for MBBS and BDS courses in government, aided, and private medical colleges across Maharashtra.Candidates who participated in the counselling process can now access their allotment status and download the seat allotment letter from the official website: cetcell.mahacet.org. The reporting period for allotted candidates is from August 14 to August 22, 2025, excluding August 15 and 16. It's imperative for candidates to adhere to these dates to confirm their admission and proceed with the necessary documentation.How to check the round 1 seat allotment resultTo view and download the seat allotment letter, candidates should follow these steps:Visit the official website: cetcell.mahacet.org.Navigate to the "NEET UG Counselling 2025" section.Click on the "Round 1 Seat Allotment Result" link.Enter your login credentials (Application Number and Password).View and download the seat allotment letter for future reference.Direct link here.What to do after seat allotmentCandidates who have been allotted a seat are required to report to the respective colleges between August 14 and August 22, 2025 (excluding August 15 and 16). During this period, candidates must complete the following:Document Verification: Submit original documents for verification.Fee Payment: Pay the required admission fees.Status Retention: Fill out and submit the Status Retention Form.Failure to report within the specified timeframe may result in the cancellation of the allotted seat.Guidelines for candidatesCandidates should ensure that all details in the seat allotment letter, such as name, category, and allotted college, are accurate.In case of any discrepancies or grievances, candidates must contact the CET Cell immediately for resolution.Stay updated with any further announcements or instructions by regularly checking the official website.This seat allotment is the second to final step in the NEET UG 2025 admission process, and candidates are advised to follow all instructions diligently to secure their admission.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousJanmashtami 2025: Manasi Parekh’s Festive LooksEntertainmentPavitra Punia’s Accessories Speak Louder Than SBI Clerk waitlist 2025 out for Junior Associates at sbi.co.in: Check direct link to download PDF list here
The State Bank of India (SBI) has released the first waiting list for Junior Associates (Customer Support & Sales) recruitment 2025 on sbi.co.in, covering non-joining and resignation cases. The list, including Ladakh’s special drive, is provisional, subject to eligibility, local language proficiency, and document verification. Candidates can download the PDF via the SBI Careers section.
SBI Clerk waitlist 2025 out for Junior Associates at sbi.co.in: Check direct link to download PDF list here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsSBI Clerk waitlist 2025 out for Junior Associates at sbi.co.in: Check direct link to download PDF list hereSBI Clerk waitlist 2025 out for Junior Associates at sbi.co.in: Check direct link to download PDF list hereTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 08:48 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe State Bank of India (SBI) has released the first waiting list for Junior Associates (Customer Support & Sales) recruitment 2025 on sbi.co.in, covering non-joining and resignation cases. The list, including Ladakh’s special drive, is provisional, subject to eligibility, local language proficiency, and document verification. Candidates can download the PDF via the SBI Careers section.  The State Bank of India (SBI) has released the first waiting list for the recruitment of Junior Associates (Customer Support and Sales) against non-joining and resignation cases. Candidates who were placed on the waitlist can now check their selection status through the SBI Clerk waiting list 2025, which includes the roll numbers of provisionally shortlisted candidates, on the official website: sbi.co.in. SBI has clarified that the selection of candidates will be provisional and subject to qualifying the proficiency test in the local language, meeting all eligibility criteria, and verifying the authenticity of information provided during registration. In addition, the bank has also announced a separate waitlist for the special recruitment drive for the Union Territory of Ladakh, covering Leh and Kargil Valley. A total of 13 candidates have been shortlisted under this category for further procedure. Candidates became eligible for selection in the waitlist after initially selected candidates either did not join or resigned, resulting in vacant positions.How to download SBI Clerk waiting list 2025Candidates can follow the steps below to download the SBI Clerk waiting list 2025 PDF from the official website.  Visit the official website: sbi.co.in   Navigate to the Careers section.   Select the Recruitment Results tab.   Click on the link titled “Waiting List of Provisionally Selected Candidates”.   The PDF will appear on the screen.   Download and save it for future reference.   Direct link to download SBI Clerk waiting list 2025 is available here: Link 1, Link 2SBI Clerk Main examination 2025 overview The Main examination was conducted on April 10 and April 12 for candidates who cleared the preliminary examination, and the SBI Clerk Main Result 2025 was declared on June 11 for 14,191 vacancies. For direct access, candidates can visit the SBI official website’s careers page and follow the above steps to obtain the PDF of provisionally selected candidates.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now.
