Javed Akhtar: Initially there was no Sambha in 'Sholay'
Javed Akhtar reflects on the making of 'Sholay,' revealing initial character concepts like Thakur as an army officer and Jai-Veeru as undisciplined recruits. He discusses the accidental creation of Samba and emphasizes Gabbar's asexuality as a key element of his powerful villain persona. Akhtar also shares insights into the film's initial poor reception and Salim-Javed's unwavering confidence in its success.
"We never doubted 'Sholay' — Not even for a second": Javed Akhtar on 50 years of the iconic classic | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNews"We never doubted 'Sholay' — Not even for a second": Javed Akhtar on 50 years of the iconic classic"We never doubted 'Sholay' — Not even for a second": Javed Akhtar on 50 years of the iconic classicTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 10:55 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeJaved Akhtar reflects on the making of 'Sholay,' revealing initial character concepts like Thakur as an army officer and Jai-Veeru as undisciplined recruits. He discusses the accidental creation of Samba and emphasizes Gabbar's asexuality as a key element of his powerful villain persona. Akhtar also shares insights into the film's initial poor reception and Salim-Javed's unwavering confidence in its success.  As 'Sholay' turns 50 tomorrow (August 15th), its legacy remains as unshakable as the rocky cliffs of Ramgarh. Few films in Indian cinema have transcended generations the way Ramesh Sippy’s magnum opus has — its dialogues, characters, and even silences etched into popular culture. But behind the spectacle lies a creation born from instinct, conviction, and an unflinching belief in its own storytelling. In this candid conversation with ETimes, Javed Akhtar — one half of the legendary Salim-Javed duo — revisits the genesis of the film, reveals the lesser-known transformations of its characters, and shares why neither he nor Salim ever doubted Sholay, even when the world thought it had failed.Javed Saab, you must be so fed up of talking about 'Sholay'?I’ve said it all over and over again. Obviously, I can’t change the narrative just to make it interesting every time. Jo tha, woh tha. That’s it.The making of Thakur’s characterLet’s begin with the character of Thakur.To begin with, Thakur was not a Thakur at all, but a retired army officer who had lost his hands in action. Jai and Veeru were initially two undisciplined recruits thrown out of the army. He chased them and asked for their help.But then Salim and I thought that if you portray army characters, you must maintain a certain dignity and discipline, and there would be restrictions. Showing undisciplined recruits was also not a good idea. So, we made Thakur a police officer and turned Jai and Veeru into petty criminals. That’s how it started.So originally, Sanjeev Kumar’s character had lost his hands as an army officer?Yes. A hand grenade exploded. But that idea was dropped, and we brought the character into the police force. Jai and Veeru became petty criminals who, despite being in police custody, once saved Thakur’s life. He was the man who had arrested them, but this act formed a good impression, and he later called them for help.How other characters came inWhen we began developing the screenplay, other characters entered — Basanti, Radha, Imam Sahab, Ramlal (played by Satyen Kappu, who worked for Thakur), and many others. Interestingly, at the screenplay stage, there was no Samba.The birth of SambaReally? How did Samba happen?When I was writing Gabbar’s introduction scene, Samba was born. Important people often have sycophants who talk about their achievements. Gabbar had to boast about the ₹50,000 reward for his arrest — a huge sum back then — but he wouldn’t say it himself; it was beneath his dignity. So, we gave him a yes-man.Once we did that, we realised it was a good gimmick. The idea was that whenever Gabbar was in thought, he would call Samba and ask something. But Samba actually answers only once — about the ₹50,000 reward. Later, when Gabbar asks, “Ramgarh ke log apni ladkiyon ko kaun se chakki ka aata khilate hain?” Samba has no reply. In the entire film, Samba speaks just one line.On Gabbar’s asexualityGabbar is terrifying, but also completely asexual. Even when he ties up the girl, he sneers but never leers. Gabbar, Mogambo, or even Shakal from Shaan — they are all totally asexual. They are never interested in women. If a powerful villain starts lusting after a woman, he looks like a beggar.How a beggar?It’s below a powerful villain’s dignity to go after anything. Lust is not power; it makes you look like a lecher, and lechery isn’t dignified.In Shaan, Shakal kidnaps Raakhee Gulzar’s character and tells her she’ll be held until her husband comes to save her. She’s tense, thinking he might keep her for the night. He smiles and says, “Don’t flatter yourself. I am not interested in you at all. You don’t attract me.”Why Shakal didn’t work like GabbarWhy do you think Shakal didn’t click like Gabbar? Was he too urban? Too James Bond?No, it wasn’t Shakal. It was the film that didn’t work. It wasn’t made from the heart. There was an anxiety to perform — performance anxiety — and that killed it. Otherwise, the characters and performances were very good.RD Burman’s music — Shaan vs SholayIn my opinion, RD Burman’s music was better in Shaan than in Sholay, except for the background score.I don’t think Sholay’s songs were very good. 'Mehbooba O Mehbooba' and 'Yeh Dosti' were hits, but they were situational. In fact, the EPs and LPs of the dialogues sold much more than the songs. The first EP was titled Viru Ki Shaadi. The verbal sold far more than the musical.RD really excelled in the background music, not the songs. Maybe when he saw the complete film, he realised the songs were comparatively weaker, so he compensated in the background score — and he did that with vengeance.When 'Sholay' opened poorlyWhen the film released, the team was anxious because it wasn’t doing well. You even planned to change the ending?Not us. Not Salim-Javed. Not for a second did we think the film would go wrong. Others got nervous, but our confidence never wavered. In the first week itself, on Friday, we gave an ad in Screen, Film Information and Trade Guide that Salim-Javed guarantee Sholay will do more than ₹1 crore. We put our money where our mouth was — when the industry was convinced it had failed.The team had an emergency meeting at Amitabh Bachchan’s home?No. He was neither that important nor powerful then for us to go to his house for such a meeting. It happened at my place. Bachchan Saab, GP Sippy, and Ramesh Sippy came over, and the five of us discussed the situation. We told them, “Don’t worry. Nothing will happen to you.” Not for a second did we think the picture could fail. We gave ads, and the rest is history.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousJanmashtami 2025: Manasi Parekh’s Filmmaker Murali Mohan passes away at 57
Kannada film industry mourns the demise of director Murali Mohan, known for his collaborations with superstar Upendra in iconic movies like 'Om', 'Shhh', and 'Tarle Nan Maga'. He had been battling a prolonged illness and undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Bengaluru. Despite financial assistance from friends and colleagues, his health deteriorated, leading to his passing.
Filmmaker Murali Mohan passes away at 57; directed hits with Upendra, Shiva Rajkumar; battled kidney ailments for years | Kannada Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNewsFilmmaker Murali Mohan passes away at 57; directed hits with Upendra, Shiva Rajkumar; battled kidney ailments for yearsFilmmaker Murali Mohan passes away at 57; directed hits with Upendra, Shiva Rajkumar; battled kidney ailments for yearsEntertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 10:47 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKannada film industry mourns the demise of director Murali Mohan, known for his collaborations with superstar Upendra in iconic movies like 'Om', 'Shhh', and 'Tarle Nan Maga'. He had been battling a prolonged illness and undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Bengaluru. Despite financial assistance from friends and colleagues, his health deteriorated, leading to his passing. (Picture Courtesy: Facebook) The Kannada film fraternity is mourning the loss of director Murali Mohan, a filmmaker who left a lasting imprint on the industry through his collaborations with some of its biggest stars.Best known for helming 'Nagarahavu' with Real Star Upendra, Santha with Hat-trick Hero Shivarajkumar, and Mallikarjuna with Crazy Star Ravichandran, Murali Mohan passed away in Bengaluru on August 13. He was 57. His death comes after a long and difficult battle with kidney-related ailments.The news was shared by the director Prakasharaj Mehu via social media. Taking to Facebook handle he wrote, "Murali Mohan was one of the driving forces behind the film Om! The reason I say this is because, during the story discussions at Vajreshwari Productions that I was part of, every time the topic of Om came up, Varadanna would fondly remember Murali and the contribution he made to that film!! He praised Murali’s intelligence. It is a tragedy that his true talent was never fully utilised in the Kannada film industry!!!"Prakasharaj Mehu further wrote, "Seeing people like him makes one believe the saying that nothing else grows under a big banyan tree. Murali, who always spoke about God, religion, meditation, homa, and havan, appeared to me more like the head of a monastery than a film director. He had bought a plot in Uttarahalli, but it got caught up with the Rajakaluve (stormwater drain). He struggled a lot to save it. Today, he has become free from all such concerns. Salutations to you, Murali — may the heaven you believed in be yours…” — Prakash Raj Mehu, Writer and Film Director."A long fight against illnessFor years, Murali Mohan had been undergoing treatment at a private hospital on JC Road in Bengaluru. His condition had required costly surgeries. Reportedly, he had publicly appealed for financial help when medical expenses mounted to an estimated Rs 30–35 lakh. Friends, colleagues, and well-wishers rallied to his side, raising funds and offering support. Despite their efforts, his health continued to decline, and he breathed his last on Wednesday.Friendship with UpendraMurali Mohan’s had a long standing bond with the superstar Upendra. That bond evolved into a creative partnership on several projects, including cult hits like 'Om', 'Shhh', and 'Tarle Nan Maga', where he contributed behind the scenes.About the AuthorEntertainment Deskमटा मनोरंजन डेस्क ही मराठी आणि हिंदी चित्रपट, ओटीटी, संगीत, मराठी टीव्ही कार्यक्रम, वेब सिरीज आणि सेलिब्रिटी बातम्यांवर केंद्रित एक उत्साही टीम आहे. चित्रपट समीक्षण, कलाकारांच्या मुलाखती, ट्रेलर विश्लेषण, गॉसिप्स आणि सोशल मीडिया ट्रेंड्सवरील विश्वासार्ह आणि मनोरंजक माहिती आम्ही सर्जनशील शैलीत वाचकांपर्यंत पोहोचवितो. माहिती आणि मनोरंजन यांचा समतोल राखणे हे आमचे वैशिष्ट्य आहे.Read MoreEnd of Real or Fake: Fans debate over Jr NTR's abs in 'War 2'
Jr NTR's appearance in 'War 2' has ignited a social media frenzy. Fans are captivated by the actor's sculpted physique in the opening scene, sparking debate over its authenticity. While many admirers are praising his transformation and calling his abs a 'work of art,' others are skeptical, suggesting the use of CGI.
'War 2': Jr NTR’s 8-Pack abs leave netizens divided; Fans ask 'Real abs or bad VFX?' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNews'War 2': Jr NTR’s 8-Pack abs leave netizens divided; Fans ask 'Real abs or bad VFX?''War 2': Jr NTR’s 8-Pack abs leave netizens divided; Fans ask 'Real abs or bad VFX?'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 10:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeJr NTR's appearance in 'War 2' has ignited a social media frenzy. Fans are captivated by the actor's sculpted physique in the opening scene, sparking debate over its authenticity. While many admirers are praising his transformation and calling his abs a 'work of art,' others are skeptical, suggesting the use of CGI.  'War 2' hit theatres today and fans who rushed for the early screenings had a lot to say. One hot topic of discussion among fans, was lead actor Jr NTR’s chiselled 8-pack abs in his opening scene. Social media has been abuzz with fans debating over whether the actor's ripped physique is the result of intense training or heavy-handed VFX.Several admirers of the star took to their Twitter handles to share photos of the actor flexing his abs in a shirtless scene and praise the actor’s transformation. One fan wrote, "#JrNTR's cinematic journey has been undoubtedly inspirational..."However, not everyone is convinced. A section of viewers claimed the abs looked “artificial,” sparking speculation about the use of CGI. Critics even described the scene as “Worst ever VFX", arguing it took away from the realism of the action sequences. One asked, "If this is really in the movie then they have spoiled the original aura of #JrNTR. Can anyone confirm? Why to show fake abs always??"Still another said, "Worst. VFX. Ever. Who approved this 'muscle pack'?"About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousJanmashtami 2025: Manasi Parekh’s Coolie beats Vikram to become 9th biggest Tamil film
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, has shattered North American box office records, earning an estimated USD 2.9 million on its premiere day. This impressive opening has already propelled 'Coolie' to become the 9th biggest Tamil grosser ever in North America, surpassing Kamal Haasan’s 'Vikram' and two other Rajinikanth films.

This impressive opening has already propelled 'Coolie' to become the 9th biggest Tamil grosser ever in North America, surpassing Kamal Haasan’s 'Vikram' and two other Rajinikanth films. Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, has shattered North American box office records, earning an estimated USD 2.9 million on its premiere day. This impressive opening has already propelled 'Coolie' to become the 9th biggest Tamil grosser ever in North America, surpassing Kamal Haasan’s 'Vikram' and two other Rajinikanth films. Superstar Rajinikanth has once again proved his box office dominance, this time in spectacular fashion with the release of Coolie. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the much-anticipated action drama has shattered records on its very first day in North America, earning an estimated USD 2.9 million from its premiere day shows alone as per distributor Prathyangira Cinemas.What makes this number remarkable is not just the sheer scale of the opening but the fact that Coolie has already become the 9th biggest Tamil grosser ever in North America beating Kamal Haasan’s Vikram( ( USD 2.84 million) coincidentally also directed by Lokesh Kanagraj . With these numbers Rajinikanth was not only able to dethrone Vikram but also went passed his other two films Vettiyan ( USD 2.83 million ) and Petta ( USD 2.51 million) While, Vikram, Petta and Vettaiyan achieved their totals over several weeks of play, Coolie has managed to match or surpass those numbers within hours. The performance r underlines the unprecedented pre-release buzz around the film, driven by the high-profile pairing of Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj. The latter is one of Tamil cinema’s most sought-after directors, and his collaboration with the Superstar for the first time had already generated a level of anticipation that translated directly into massive advance bookings.Given that Coolie’s opening day is not yet over, the film is well on track to break into the top 10 biggest Tamil films in North America before the day concludes. In fact, early forecasts suggest that by the time full day-one figures are tallied, Coolie could land in the 8th position on the all-time list.This kind of start all but guarantees that Coolie will be a dominant force in the coming days. If the positive audience reception matches the hype and early social media chatter indicates it does the film could aim for an even higher rank, possibly challenging the top five Tamil grossers in the market.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousJanmashtami 2025: Manasi Parekh’s ‘Coolie’ to challenge 2.0’s day 1 record of Rs 60 crore
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is poised to challenge the opening day record set by his own film, 2.0. With massive advance bookings already at Rs 46.36 crore, fueled by a star-studded cast and the Rajinikanth-Lokesh Kanagaraj combination, 'Coolie' is expected to potentially surpass Rs 60 crore on day one.
Rajinikanth to break Rajinikanth’s record : ‘Coolie’ all set to challenge ‘2.0’ day 1 record of Rs 60 crore | Tamil Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNewsRajinikanth to break Rajinikanth’s record : ‘Coolie’ all set to challenge ‘2.0’ day 1 record of Rs 60 croreRajinikanth to break Rajinikanth’s record : ‘Coolie’ all set to challenge ‘2.0’ day 1 record of Rs 60 croreTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 10:09 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is poised to challenge the opening day record set by his own film, 2.0. With massive advance bookings already at Rs 46.36 crore, fueled by a star-studded cast and the Rajinikanth-Lokesh Kanagaraj combination, 'Coolie' is expected to potentially surpass Rs 60 crore on day one. Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is poised to challenge the opening day record set by his own film, 2.0. With massive advance bookings already at Rs 46.36 crore, fueled by a star-studded cast and the Rajinikanth-Lokesh Kanagaraj combination, 'Coolie' is expected to potentially surpass Rs 60 crore on day one. Superstar Rajinikanth is on the verge of creating box office history once again by toppling his own record. The actor’s latest outing, Coolie, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, has registered staggering advance booking numbers, setting the stage for an opening that could challenge the benchmark he set back in 2018 with 2.0.Back then, 2.0, co-starring Akshay Kumar and directed by Shankar, opened to a record-smashing Rs 60.25 crore in India across all languages on its first day. Six years later, Coolie is primed to chase down that milestone, riding on unprecedented audience excitement and a star-studded ensemble.Massive advance bookingsAccording to early data, Coolie has clocked an advance booking gross of Rs 37.2 crore from 1.73 million tickets sold across India without counting block seats. Factoring in those blocked seats, the figure jumps to a staggering Rs 46.36 crore, putting the film well within striking distance of 2.0’s opening day total even before the first show has rolled out.Breaking down the numbers, the Tamil version leads the charge with Rs 27.92 crore from over 1.29 million tickets, spread across 7,235 shows with the rest coming in from Telugu, Hindi and Kannada versions. The combined show count for all languages stands at 13,083, a testament to the scale at which Coolie is rolling out nationwide.The buzz around Coolie has been fuelled by the blockbuster combination of Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj, one of Tamil cinema’s most successful contemporary directors. Known for creating high-energy, mass-entertainer spectacles, Lokesh has previously delivered back-to-back blockbusters, and his collaboration with the Superstar marks a dream pairing for fans.The cast only adds to the film’s appeal, with prominent names such as Nagarjuna, Soubin Shahir, Shruti Haasan, Sathyaraj, Upendra, and even Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan in a pivotal role. By 10 AM the film has already minted Rs 14.25 crore. Trade analysts point out that with such a high advance booking figure and the expected surge in spot bookings Coolie could potentially breach the RS 60 crore mark on day one, making it the biggest opener in Rajinikanth’s career and one of the top openings in Indian cinema history.With just advance booking numbers Coolie sits on 3rd spot and Jailer being on 2nd spot with Rs 48 crore collection. Even if Coolie fails to beat 2.0’s numbers as it has less shows thanks to clash with War 2 starring Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani, it will become Rajinikanth’s second biggest day 1 opener. But if it happens, it would mean Rajinikanth surpassing Rajinikanth, dethroning his own 2.0 record after six years. All eyes are now on the first-day actuals. If early trends are any indication, Coolie won’t just be a commercial win, it could be a career-defining moment in Rajinikanth’s already illustrious journey. Shilpa-Raj booked in Rs 60.4 crore FRAUD CASE
Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra are under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) for allegedly defrauding a businessman of ₹60.4 crore. The couple, along with an unidentified individual, are accused of misappropriating funds from Deepak Kothari, intended for their now-defunct company, Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd, between 2015 and 2023.
Shilpa Shetty and husband Raj Kundra booked by EOW in Rs 60.4 crore FRAUD CASE; businessman accuses couple of misappropriation of funds | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNewsShilpa Shetty and husband Raj Kundra booked by EOW in Rs 60.4 crore FRAUD CASE; businessman accuses couple of misappropriation of fundsShilpa Shetty and husband Raj Kundra booked by EOW in Rs 60.4 crore FRAUD CASE; businessman accuses couple of misappropriation of fundsTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 09:53 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra are under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) for allegedly defrauding a businessman of ₹60.4 crore. The couple, along with an unidentified individual, are accused of misappropriating funds from Deepak Kothari, intended for their now-defunct company, Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd, between 2015 and 2023.  Bollywood actor Shilpa Shetty Kundra and her husband and businessman Raj Kundra, along with an unidentified individual, have been booked by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Mumbai Police for allegedly defrauding a city-based businessman. Police ReportAccording to the police report, the three were involved in a loan-cum-investment deal linked of Rs 60.4 crore to their now-defunct company Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd. Businessman Deepak Kothari has alleged that the couple 'misappropriated funds' he provided between 2015 and 2023 for business expansion. He also alleges that they diverted the funds for personal use. The case was initially registered at Juhu Police Station under sections related to cheating and forgery. However, it was later transferred to the EOW after it was determined that the amount involved exceeded Rs 10 crore.Complaint RegisteredThe complaint, according to ANI, alleges that the accused initially sought a Rs 75 crore loan at 12% interest but later persuaded him to provide the funds as an “investment” to reduce tax liabilities. He was reportedly assured monthly returns along with repayment of the principal.The AllegationsKothari, a Juhu resident, stated in his complaint that he was introduced to Shetty and Kundra by one Rajesh Arya. At the time, the couple were directors of Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd, a home shopping and online retail platform, and collectively held 87.6% of its shares.He claims to have transferred Rs 31.9 crore in April 2015 under a share subscription agreement, followed by another Rs 28.53 crore in September 2015 under a supplementary agreement. Despite offering a personal guarantee in April 2016, Shetty resigned as director in September that year, the FIR notes. Kothari later discovered that the company had entered bankruptcy proceedings in 2017 after defaulting on another agreement.Police confirmed that an investigation is underway and that further details will be shared as the case progresses.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. 'War 2' box office early estimates Day 1
Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' has debuted with an estimated ₹30 crore opening, earning ₹6.16 crore in India so far. Ayan Mukerji's directorial venture is receiving mixed reviews, with praise for action but criticism for its storyline. Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie' leads with ₹11.63 crore.
'War 2' box office early estimates Day 1: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NRT starrer off to Rs 6 crore start; Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' collections double with Rs 11 crore haul | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNews'War 2' box office early estimates Day 1: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NRT starrer off to Rs 6 crore start; Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' collections double with Rs 11 crore haul'War 2' box office early estimates Day 1: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NRT starrer off to Rs 6 crore start; Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' collections double with Rs 11 crore haulTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 09:22 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' has debuted with an estimated ₹30 crore opening, earning ₹6.16 crore in India so far. Ayan Mukerji's directorial venture is receiving mixed reviews, with praise for action but criticism for its storyline. Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie' leads with ₹11.63 crore.  'War 2' has finally hit theatres, and early estimates suggest a promising start for the Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR-led action thriller. Early Box Office EstimatesThe film that is reportedly tracking an estimated Rs 30 crore opening, set the cash registers ringing this Thursday morning, by recording a good start at the box office. According to industry tracker Sacnilk, the film has raked in approximately Rs 6.16 crore India net across all languages so far.'War 2' kicked off with strong morning show occupancies, managing to cross the Rs 5 crore mark with just early ticket sales and first shows. The numbers are expected to see a significant jump during the high-traffic evening and night shows, which traditionally contribute the bulk of first-day collections.Directed by Ayan Mukerji, the film has been generating mixed reactions from audiences. While many have praised the high-octane action sequences, grand scale, and the on-screen presence of Hrithik and Jr NTR, others have criticised its template storyline and uneven pacing. Social media reviews ranged from “Fun & paisa vasool” to labelling it “strictly MID” and “a recycled, same-old template.”Coolie's Impressive CollectionsHowever, the box office battle this Independence Day weekend is far from one-sided. Sharing the release date with 'War 2' is superstar Rajinikanth’s highly anticipated 'Coolie', which, as per early estimates, has recorded nearly double the earnings. The action entertainer has reportedly grossed Rs 11.63 crore India net across all languages so far, fuelled by massive fan turnout, particularly in South India.With both films eyeing a strong Independence Day holiday boost, trade analysts predict a huge Rs 80 crore combined box office earning this Thursday.For now, 'Coolie' holds the lead, but it remains to be seen if 'War 2' has what it takes to narrow the gap later in the day. Both films are also expected to receive a huge boost in collections on Friday, considering that it is a national holiday. Zeeshan reveals how Shah Rukh saved his acting career
Zeeshan Ayyub, contemplating quitting acting due to typecasting, found unexpected support from Shah Rukh Khan during 'Raees.' Ayyub revealed that SRK's simple gesture and encouraging words reignited his passion, altering his perspective entirely. This pivotal moment gave him the confidence to persevere. Ayyub is now preparing for Anurag Kashyap’s 'Nishaanchi', scheduled for release on September 19.
Zeeshan Ayyub reveals how Shah Rukh Khan saved his acting career; opens up about tough times: ' I felt all the negativity melt away' | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNewsZeeshan Ayyub reveals how Shah Rukh Khan saved his acting career; opens up about tough times: ' I felt all the negativity melt away'Zeeshan Ayyub reveals how Shah Rukh Khan saved his acting career; opens up about tough times: ' I felt all the negativity melt away'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 08:42 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeZeeshan Ayyub, contemplating quitting acting due to typecasting, found unexpected support from Shah Rukh Khan during 'Raees.' Ayyub revealed that SRK's simple gesture and encouraging words reignited his passion, altering his perspective entirely. This pivotal moment gave him the confidence to persevere. Ayyub is now preparing for Anurag Kashyap’s 'Nishaanchi', scheduled for release on September 19.  In a candid revelation, Zeeshan Ayyub, known for his impactful performances in films like 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' and 'Raees,' recently shared how a pivotal moment with Shah Rukh Khan during the filming of 'Raees' prevented him from quitting acting. Feeling typecast and creatively stifled, Ayyub was on the verge of giving up until a simple gesture and encouraging words from the superstar reignited his passion for the craft and changed his perspective entirely.Read on to learn more.Zeeshan Ayyub opens up about being typecastFeeling stuck in similar roles and frustrated with typecasting, Zeeshan admits he was close to quitting. “I was really struggling at that point. I thought maybe this isn’t for me anymore,” he shared candidly in a chat with Digital Commentary. It was indeed a vulnerable moment for the actor as he had been giving his all but wasn’t finding the creative satisfaction he longed for.Zeeshan Ayyub talks about Shah Rukh Khan’s timely supportIn 'Raees,' Ayyub played Sadiq Ibrahim, Shah Rukh Khan’s on-screen friend in the action drama. He recalls how SRK noticed his inner turmoil and offered a gesture that would change his mindset completely. “Kuch toh kiya tha uss aadmi ne, badal diya tha andar se. When he shook my hand, I felt all the negativity melt away. I realized there’s still so much work to do,” Zeeshan said. The superstar’s encouragement didn’t just lift his spirits, it also reminded him of his love for acting and gave him the confidence to push forward. “He stopped me in my tracks and told me, ‘Work here, everything will be fine.’ That one moment changed everything,” Zeeshan added. Zeeshan Ayyub on the work frontWith renewed motivation, Zeeshan is now gearing up for his next big project, Anurag Kashyap’s 'Nishaanchi', starring newcomer Aaishvary Thackeray along with Monika Panwar, Vedika Pinto, and Kumud Mishra. The film is scheduled to release on September 19. Meanwhile, the actor was last seen in 'Kaalidhar Laapata' starring Abhishek Bachchan and Nimrat Kaur in the lead. The movie was directed by Madhumita Sundararaman and Zeeshan Ayyub played the role of Subodh in the movie.Lilliput slams Shah Rukh Khan’s role in 'Zero', Says ‘Not even equal to Kamal Haasan’s dust'About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. War 2 Twitter Reviews: Fans say 'Not great, not bad - strictly MID'
War 2 has ignited a frenzy among fans, with early screenings drawing massive crowds. Initial reactions are divided, praising the action and star performances of Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, while some criticize the storyline and pacing. The film's grand scale and thrilling moments are highlighted, but concerns arise over the second half's execution and predictable plot elements.
War 2 Twitter Reviews: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR starrer opens to MIXED reviews; audiences hail first half, say film is 'Not great, not bad - Strictly MID' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodWar 2 Twitter Reviews: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR starrer opens to MIXED reviews; audiences hail first half, say film is 'Not great, not bad - Strictly MID'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionWar 2 Twitter Reviews: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR starrer opens to MIXED reviews; audiences hail first half, say film is 'Not great, not bad - Strictly MID'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 08:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWar 2 has ignited a frenzy among fans, with early screenings drawing massive crowds. Initial reactions are divided, praising the action and star performances of Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, while some criticize the storyline and pacing. The film's grand scale and thrilling moments are highlighted, but concerns arise over the second half's execution and predictable plot elements.  The much-awaited War 2 has finally been released in cinemas around the world, and fans of leading stars Hrithik Roshan with Jr NTR can't keep calm. Fans around the globe got together to celebrate the film's release by rushing to theatres to catch the early shows of the pan-India spy spectacle directed by Ayan Mukerji. The film that was touted to be one of the biggest cinematic events of the year, got a hero's welcome with some fans lining up as early as 4 am on Thursday morning to catch the screening. Some others even fired off crackers and conducted pooja ceremonies outside the theatres to celebrate its release.While fan excitement was sky-high, early Twitter reviews reveal a mixed bag — with praise for the action and star power, but criticism over the storyline, pacing, and execution.Within hours of its release, Twitter was flooded with posts from moviegoers sharing their first impressions. Many fans praised the film’s action-packed first half, admitting, "Very Good First Half."Several praised the engaging pace and larger-than-life moments, particularly the whistle-worthy entry scenes. A fan enthused, “Coolie will get a tough competition! #War2 is a clean Block Buster! What a dance, screen dominance of NTR.” Others appreciated the film’s grand scale and buildup.However, a section of the audience pointed out that while the first half was gripping, the second half felt comparatively weaker, with pacing issues and predictable plot turns. Some even summed up their experience with the blunt verdict saying, “#War2 is a strictly mediocre action thriller, leaning heavily on style over substance! The storyline is somewhat different from the previous spy universe films, which had potential but wasn’t able to fully capitalize on it.”Another summarised their experience as, “An okayish action entertainer. Not great, not bad either – strictly MID. Note: NTR fans should keep their expectations in check. There are moments where you whistle, but there are moments that will frustrate you.”Another claimed that the film's plot was 'recycled' saying, "War 2 is a recycled, same-old template with no genuine highs or enjoyable moments between the leads in a lengthy runtime. Overall it’s a disappointing action film in YRF series after Tiger 3."Still another added, "good back story, but story falls flat & predictable. Lacks emotional connect."Some outright disliked the film, calling out the over-the-top action, and 'wasted' potential of a Hrithik and Jr NTR collab. One said, "The movie feels like small ads of mountain dews stitched together with no screenplay, poor editing, Few cringeworthy dialogues, laughable action sequences twists which can be seen from miles, one expression acting by #JrNTR..big disappointment from #RRR star! The action scenes are so bad,it feels embarassing ( B2 Bomber scene was worst)...so far just Hritik all the way..The much awaited #JanaabeAali is worst song from movie so far! Unintentionally funny with average choreography!!!"Another said, "A rare North–South star combo wasted. NTR is utterly underused, the plot is template, action is bland, and execution is weak—leaving audiences walking out dissatisfied.""War 2 is terrible," said another and added, "The film starts really well and is very engaging till they force the dance sequence out of nowhere. The film is completely derailed out of track just before the 15 mins to interval. It’s all downhill after that."Fans of both stars, however, continue to defend the film’s larger-than-life scale, its stylish cinematography, and the thrill of seeing two powerhouse performers share the screen. "Just watched War 2 here in California. I must say it’s an excellent movie with all actors acting great & the story was awesome with lots of twists & turns. CGI was not the best, but everything else was just good vibes, good story. Fun & paisa vasool," said another viewer.Another claimed that the film "Opens new horizons for Spy Universe." The fan went on to add, "Nothing forced staying exceptionally true to story! Twists that keep you entertained to end and beyond. Action larger than life, scale grandest! Music surreal. Locations breathtaking. Entertainment to the core. Builds up."War 2 sees Hrithik reprise his role as Kabir, a RAW agent with a turbulent past, now facing off against elite operative Vikram, played by Jr NTR. The globe-trotting narrative promises espionage, betrayal, and explosive action sequences — hallmarks of the Spy Universe. Kiara Advani, Ashutosh Rana, and Anil Kapoor also play pivotal roles.About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. Why eating raw tomatoes daily can boost heart, skin, and bone health
Raw tomatoes are nutritional powerhouses, offering a wide array of health benefits. Regular consumption supports heart health by regulating blood pressure and cholesterol, boosts immunity with vitamin C, and promotes radiant skin through hydration and antioxidants. Additionally, tomatoes strengthen bones with vitamin K and support brain and vision health with essential nutrients.
Why eating raw tomatoes daily can boost heart, skin, and bone health | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipfood newsHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipestravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylefood-newsWhy eating raw tomatoes daily can boost heart, skin, and bone healthTrendingIndependence Day 2025Colon CancerLiver Disease SymptomsBowel Cancer SymptomsMeghan MarkleHeart AttackVitamin B12Bone Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Colon CancerLiver Disease SymptomsBowel Cancer SymptomsMeghan MarkleHeart AttackVitamin B12Bone Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Colon CancerLiver Disease SymptomsBowel Cancer SymptomsMeghan MarkleHeart AttackVitamin B12Bone Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesWhy eating raw tomatoes daily can boost heart, skin, and bone healthTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 13:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRaw tomatoes are nutritional powerhouses, offering a wide array of health benefits. Regular consumption supports heart health by regulating blood pressure and cholesterol, boosts immunity with vitamin C, and promotes radiant skin through hydration and antioxidants. Additionally, tomatoes strengthen bones with vitamin K and support brain and vision health with essential nutrients.  Raw tomatoes are more than just a kitchen staple; they are a nutritional powerhouse that can support overall health in numerous ways. Packed with vitamins, antioxidants and essential minerals such as vitamin C, potassium, and lycopene, raw tomatoes provide a wide range of benefits for the body. Regular consumption can support heart health by reducing blood pressure and cholesterol levels, boost immunity, aid digestion thanks to their fiber content, and protect against chronic diseases including certain cancers.Beyond internal health, the antioxidants in raw tomatoes also benefit the skin, helping to maintain a healthy glow and combat signs of aging. Their natural hydration and low-calorie profile make them an ideal addition for anyone looking to maintain weight while improving nutrition. Versatile and easy to include in daily meals, raw tomatoes can be enjoyed in salads, sandwiches, salsas, or even as juice. This makes them one of the simplest and most effective ways to enhance your daily nutrient intake and promote long-term wellness. According to studies published in NIH and research done by Research Gate, this article explores why making raw tomatoes a regular part of your diet can be a game-changer for boosting heart, skin, and bone health.Health benefits of eating raw tomatoes dailyHeart health benefits of raw tomatoesStudies by NIH show, raw tomatoes are packed with potassium and lycopene, two nutrients that play a key role in maintaining heart health. Potassium helps regulate blood pressure, while lycopene works as a powerful antioxidant to reduce cholesterol levels and protect cardiovascular function. Eating raw tomatoes regularly may lower the risk of heart disease, improve overall circulation, and support a healthy cardiovascular system. Including them in daily meals is a simple way to give your heart a natural boost.Boosting immunity with raw tomatoesRaw tomatoes are loaded with vitamin C, a vital nutrient that plays a central role in strengthening the immune system. Eating them regularly can help the body fight infections more effectively, support faster recovery from illnesses, and maintain overall health. Vitamin C also acts as a powerful antioxidant, protecting cells from damage caused by free radicals, reducing inflammation, and supporting skin health. Including raw tomatoes in your daily diet can therefore provide multiple layers of protection, keeping both your immune system and overall wellbeing in top shape.Skin and hydration supportResearch published in Research Gate shows that raw tomatoes are naturally rich in water, vitamins A and C, and antioxidants, all of which contribute to healthy, radiant skin. Their high water content helps keep the skin hydrated, while vitamin C supports collagen production, essential for maintaining skin elasticity and firmness. Antioxidants like lycopene protect the skin from damage caused by free radicals and environmental stressors, reducing the appearance of fine lines and early signs of aging. Including raw tomatoes in your daily diet can help promote a glowing complexion and support overall skin health naturally.Bone health and essential nutrientsRaw tomatoes are a good source of vitamin K, which plays a vital role in maintaining strong bones and supporting proper blood clotting. In addition, minerals such as potassium and magnesium found in tomatoes contribute to overall skeletal health by helping regulate calcium balance and supporting bone density. Including raw tomatoes in your daily diet can therefore not only benefit the heart and skin but also strengthen bones and promote long-term musculoskeletal wellbeing.Brain and vision supportTomatoes are rich in beta-carotene, lutein, and lycopene, powerful antioxidants that according to a study in NIH supports eye health. Beta-carotene helps maintain good vision, lutein protects the eyes from harmful light exposure, and lycopene reduces oxidative stress. Regular consumption of these nutrients may also offer protective benefits for brain health, potentially lowering the risk of age-related cognitive decline. Including tomatoes in your daily diet is a simple way to support both eye function and long-term mental sharpness.Easy ways to include raw tomatoes in your dietSalads: Mix sliced tomatoes with leafy greens and herbs.Sandwiches & wraps: Add tomato slices for nutrition and flavor.Salsas & dips: Combine chopped tomatoes with herbs for a healthy snack.Juices & smoothies: Blend tomatoes with other vegetables for a nutrient boost.Incorporating raw tomatoes into your daily diet is an easy and effective way to support overall health. They provide nutrients that benefit the heart, boost immunity, promote glowing skin, strengthen bones, and support brain function. Beyond their nutritional value, raw tomatoes are incredibly versatile and can be enjoyed in countless ways, added to salads, sandwiches, smoothies, salsas, or simply eaten on their own. Making them a regular part of your meals allows you to take advantage of these health benefits consistently, helping to maintain energy, vitality, and overall wellness in a natural and enjoyable way.Also read| 13 Foods that can worsen anxiety and depression and what to eat instead"Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Whether you're seeking the latest fashion trends, travel escapades, culinary delights, or wellness tips, the TOI Lifestyle Desk is your one-stop destination for an enriching lifestyle experience.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousAlia Bhatt’s hairstylist warns against straightening damp hair: Know why we agree with himLifestyleZodiac signs who are known for their simplicityastrologyDO NOT ignore these warning signs of a heart attackLifestyleDipika Kakar’s top 10 gorgeous ethnic looks for festive seasontvJanmashtami 2025: Manasi Parekh’s Festive LooksEntertainmentPavitra Punia’s Accessories Speak Louder Than WordstvJyotika style moments that prove simplicity can be stunningEntertainmentGorgeous pictures of Sonia AggarwalEntertainmentRajinikanth’s style and makeover over the yearsEntertainmentSuperstar turns golden: 50 years of Rajinikanth in picturesEntertainment Next123 Photostories  Independence Day: Unveiling 10 rare pictures from India’s struggle for freedom7 foods to strictly avoid in monsoon seasonGuard deployed, protests erupt: National Guard steps up presence in Washington; How to set up a planted aquarium at home and the types of fish to keep: 10-step guide
A planted aquarium not only looks beautiful, but it also helps maintaining a natural balance in the tank thus promoting the well-being of your pet fish. Here we list a simple 10-step guide to set it up and choose the right fish:
How to set up a planted aquarium at home and the types of fish to keep: 10-step guide | Times of IndiaAug 14, 2025How to set up a planted aquarium at home and the types of fish to keep: 10-step guideetimes.in10-step guide to set up a planted aquariumA planted aquarium not only looks beautiful, but it also helps maintaining a natural balance in the tank thus promoting the well-being of your pet fish. Here we list a simple 10-step guide to set it up and choose the right fish:CanvaChoose the right tank sizeBigger tanks are easier to maintain and provide stable water conditions. So, choosing a 40-60 litre tank (1.5-2 feet long tank) is ideal for beginners who are starting with a planted setup.CanvaSelect good quality substrateUse nutrient-rich substrate to support plant growth. You can choose aquarium soil or gravel mixed with plant fertilizers to help plants grow and stay healthy.CanvaHave proper lightingReal aquatic plants also need 7-8 hours of light daily for photosynthesis. So, use full-spectrum LED lights designed for aquariums.CanvaHave a good filtration systemA good filter keeps water clean and supports beneficial bacteria. So, choose one that is suitable for your tank size and plant density.CanvaAdd a heater (if needed)Tropical plants and fish live well when the water temperature is between 24 to 28°C. So use a reliable aquarium heater with an adjustable thermostat to maintain stable tempertures in winters.CanvaYou may also like10 things to know before getting a pet r...10 things to know before getting an Afri...Plant selectionStart with hardy aquatic plant species like Anubias, Java Fern, or Amazon Sword. These are beginner-friendly and adapt well to various water conditions.CanvaFill and condition waterUse dechlorinated water to protect fish and plants. Let the tank cycle for a few weeks before adding fish to stabilise the environment.CanvaChoose your fish wiselyPeaceful grouping fish species like Neon Tetras (middle dwellers), Guppies (top dwellers), or Corydoras (bottom dwellers) are great for planted tanks. Avoid fish that dig or uproot plants.CanvaMaintain regular cleaningPerform 20–30% water changes weekly, trim plants, and remove debris to keep the aquarium balanced and visually appealing.Canva Monitor and adjustRegularly test water parameters, observe fish behavior, and adjust lighting, feeding, or plant care as needed to maintain a thriving ecosystem.CanvaThanks For Reading!Next: 10 things to know before getting a pet rabbitRead Next



People with diabetes should never skip these 7 checks before travelling
Traveling with diabetes requires careful planning to manage blood sugar levels effectively. Essential precautions include carrying updated prescriptions, packing extra medication, and regularly monitoring glucose. Healthy snacks, staying active, and proper foot care are crucial for a safe and enjoyable trip. Prioritizing health ensures memorable experiences without compromising well-being.
People with diabetes should never skip these 7 checks before travelling | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsPeople with diabetes should never skip these 7 checks before travellingTrendingIndependence Day 2025Colon CancerLiver Disease SymptomsBowel Cancer SymptomsMeghan MarkleHeart AttackVitamin B12Bone Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Colon CancerLiver Disease SymptomsBowel Cancer SymptomsMeghan MarkleHeart AttackVitamin B12Bone Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Colon CancerLiver Disease SymptomsBowel Cancer SymptomsMeghan MarkleHeart AttackVitamin B12Bone Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesPeople with diabetes should never skip these 7 checks before travellingTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 14, 2025, 13:20 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeTraveling with diabetes requires careful planning to manage blood sugar levels effectively. Essential precautions include carrying updated prescriptions, packing extra medication, and regularly monitoring glucose. Healthy snacks, staying active, and proper foot care are crucial for a safe and enjoyable trip. Prioritizing health ensures memorable experiences without compromising well-being.  Travelling offers a chance to explore new places, experience different cultures, and create lasting memories. But for people with diabetes, it also brings unique challenges, from irregular meal times and changes in activity levels to managing medications and dealing with unfamiliar foods. These factors can easily disrupt blood sugar control if you’re not prepared. The good news is that with smart planning and a few simple precautions, you can travel safely and enjoy every moment of your journey. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and a study published in NIH, people with diabetes should take these precautions before travelling to stay healthy and manage blood sugar effectively.Don’t travel without these 7 diabetes safety checksCarry an updated prescription and medical documentsBefore you pack your bags, make an appointment with your doctor to discuss your travel plans. They can review your recent blood sugar trends, adjust your medication if needed, and ensure you’re fit for the journey.Always carry a few printed copies of your latest prescription, along with medical reports or test results from the past three months. If you’re travelling abroad, ask your doctor for a signed note describing your condition, your medication needs, and why you may be carrying syringes or insulin pens. This can help you clear airport security checks smoothly and ensure you get proper treatment in case of an emergency.Pack more medication than you think you’ll needRunning out of medicine in an unfamiliar place can be stressful, especially if it’s not easy to find the same brand or dosage. To avoid this, pack at least twice the amount of medication and insulin you would normally need for the duration of your trip.If you’re flying, keep your medicines in your carry-on bag, never in checked luggage, as extreme temperatures in the cargo hold can damage insulin. Also, divide your supplies between different bags so you still have some if one bag is lost or delayed.Keep your glucometer handyTravelling can disrupt your usual routine, which means your blood sugar may fluctuate more than usual. Monitoring your levels regularly is key to staying safe. Carry your glucometer along with extra test strips, lancets, and spare batteries.If you’re on a long journey, keep your monitoring kit, insulin, syringes, glucose tablets, and some snacks in a small, easy-to-reach bag—such as under the seat in front of you on a plane or bus. This ensures you can check your sugar and take action without delay.Carry healthy snacks for steady blood sugarUnfamiliar foods, irregular meal times, and long stretches between meals can make blood sugar control tricky. To prevent sudden spikes or drops, pack healthy, portion-controlled snacks like:Unsalted nuts or seedsFresh fruit (like apples or berries)Wholegrain crackersLow-fat yoghurtCut vegetables with hummus or a healthy dipHomemade sandwichesEating small, frequent meals instead of relying on three large meals can help you maintain stable glucose levels and avoid the temptation of unhealthy snacks while on the go.Keep moving but safelySitting for hours on a bus, train, or plane can affect your blood circulation, increase your risk of swelling, and raise the chances of blood clots. Get up and stretch your legs every hour or two, even if it’s just walking up and down the aisle.Once you reach your destination, try incorporating light exercise such as morning walks or sightseeing on foot. Just make sure to wear comfortable, well-fitted shoes to prevent blisters or foot injuries, as people with diabetes are more prone to infections and slow-healing wounds.Stay hydrated and avoid sugary drinksTravelling often means being outdoors for long periods, which increases your risk of dehydration, a condition that can cause blood sugar to rise. Keep a refillable water bottle with you and sip throughout the day.Avoid sweetened drinks, fruit juices, energy drinks, and aerated beverages, as they can cause sudden glucose spikes. If you drink tea or coffee, limit added sugar. If alcohol is on the menu, remember it can interfere with your blood sugar control, so it’s safest to skip it or drink only in moderation after checking with your doctor.Protect your feet with the right footwearFoot care is a top priority for anyone with diabetes. When travelling, choose comfort and support over fashion. Wear cushioned shoes with breathable material and avoid tight-fitting styles that may cause blisters.Avoid walking barefoot, even on beaches or around pools—as cuts, burns, or infections may go unnoticed and take longer to heal. Pack an extra pair of shoes and socks in case your footwear gets wet or uncomfortable.Travelling with diabetes may require extra effort, but it’s entirely possible to have a fun, stress-free trip if you plan ahead. Make your health a priority, carry your essentials, eat mindfully, stay active, and stay hydrated. With these precautions, you can explore new places, enjoy local experiences, and create lasting memories without compromising your well-being. After all, a well-planned journey is not just about reaching your destination, it’s about enjoying every step along the way, while keeping your health in balance.Disclaimer: This article is for general informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the guidance of a qualified healthcare provider regarding any medical condition or lifestyle change.Also Read: How stress disrupts your gut health: 5 effective ways to support your digestive well-being"Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. Billie Eilish and Linkin Park to headline Lollapalooza 2026?
Billie Eilish and Linkin Park to headline Lollapalooza 2026? Iconic artists to come to India for the first time - Here's what we know

Billie Eilish and Linkin Park to headline Lollapalooza India 2026? Reddit rumours fuel excitement among Indian fans – Here’s what we know

























 



Home Lifestyle AstrologyWhats CookingRelationshipsStyleArt and CultureGardeningBeauty and CareHealth & Wellness Healthy LivingRecipesInspireTips & TricksBuzzFashion  Beauty & CareCelebrity FashionStyleWorth InvestmentMutual FundsNewsEntertainment BollywoodCelebscoopHollywoodOriginalsBingeExploreTechnologyNewsAppsScience And FutureAutoCurrentElectricAlternateSpecialsFestive Season 2025Treks Of India101 Abu Dhabi DosCreate on IndiaOscars 2024WanderlustAyodhya Ram Mandir #FitITIndia On PlateSummer in Abu Dhabi: Totally RecommendedGive Up PlasticSustainabilityThe Great Indian Brain DrainCareersTrendingBillie Eilish and Linkin Park to headline Lollapalooza India 2026? Reddit rumours fuel excitement among Indian fans – Here’s what we knowBillie Eilish and Linkin Park to headline Lollapalooza India 2026? Reddit rumours fuel excitement among Indian fans – Here’s what we knowLollapalooza India 2026 might be shaping up to be its biggest edition yet. Rumours suggest global icons Billie Eilish and Linkin Park could headline, alongside major acts from America and India. Talks are ongoing with major alternative metal bands and EDM artists, but nothing has been officially confirmed.Nillohit BagchiUpdated: Aug 14, 2025, 10:57 IST  4  min read  The buzz around Lollapalooza India 2026 has officially begun, and if the rumours are true, fans are in for a massive treat. Insider chatter and Reddit claims suggest Billie Eilish and Linkin Park have already signed contracts for headline performances. While the organisers have yet to confirm, the news has set social media on fire, with fans speculating on what could be one of the most diverse and high-energy festival lineups in recent memory. Alongside these global stars, several other big names are reportedly in talks, making the Lollapalooza 2026 edition a highly anticipated event for music lovers in India and beyond.Rumour mill: Billie Eilish and Linkin Park to take centre stage in Lollapalooza 2026? According to insiders in Lollapalooza India’s Reddit subreddit (r/lollapaloozaind), Billie Eilish, fresh off her latest world tour, Hit Me Hard and Soft, could bring her signature mix of haunting vocals and electrifying stage presence to the festival. 
 Billie Eilish, fresh off her latest world tour, Hit Me Hard and Soft, could bring her signature mix of haunting vocals and electrifying stage presence to the festival (Credits: X/@billiesource)Scoopwhoop reported that the seven-time AMA (American Music Awards) winner Linkin Park may co-headline the music festival. The rock band’s involvement is equally exciting, marking what could be a rare and emotional live set for the legendary rock band. If confirmed, their inclusion would give Lollapalooza India a unique blend of alternative, pop, rock, and metal energy.
 Linkin Park may co-headline Lollapalooza 2026 India (Credits: X/@linkinpark)Sharing alleged inside information about Billie and Linkin Park’s rumoured sets, one Reddit user wrote, “I can confirm the following: Billie Eilish (for headline slot), Linkin Park, M.I.A., Raja Kumari, Raftaar have signed contracts officially. They are negotiating with My Chemical Romance, but the band wants more of a payout, which would affect the festival budget. David Guetta is in talks, but nothing has been signed yet, and again, like MCR, it’s both a logistical and financial issue. A lot of people have been saying Bruno Mars, but my source has told me that it is false, and they have not reached out.”
Billie Eilish and Linkin Park to take centre stage in Lollapalooza 2026? (Credits: Reddit)From M.I.A. to My Chemical Romance: Other artists rumoured to feature in the stacked lineup for Lollapalooza 2026 The same leak suggests M.I.A., Raja Kumari, and Raftaar are ‘officially’ locked in for performances, adding a mix of global hip-hop and desi rap flair. 
Negotiations are reportedly ongoing with American alt rock/metal band, My Chemical Romance (Credits: X/@rt_yourfavbands)Negotiations are reportedly ongoing with American alt-rock/metal band My Chemical Romance, though budget concerns are creating hurdles. Well-known EDM artist David Guetta is also in talks, but nothing has been signed yet. As for the widely rumoured Bruno Mars, insiders insist there’s no truth to his inclusion.A dream come true for music enthusiasts in IndiaIf the rumours prove true, Lollapalooza 2026 could mark the first-ever India performances for both Billie Eilish and Linkin Park. For long-time rock and metal fans, Linkin Park’s arrival would be a dream come true, fulfilling years of anticipation after speculation that they might come in 2025. Their music shaped an entire generation, and seeing them live in India would be a historic moment. 
Billie Eilish commands a massive fanbase in India (Credits: X/@billiesource)On the other hand, Gen Z favourite Billie Eilish commands a massive fanbase in the country, with her unique style and chart-topping hits making her one of the most anticipated potential headliners of the festival.Despite the growing excitement, festival organisers have not confirmed any of these names. Lollapalooza India is known for delivering big surprises, so fans will have to wait for the official lineup announcement. Until then, speculation will continue, and if these rumours turn into reality, 2026 might just be Indian music fans’ biggest year yet.
